loans.name: Chantsal

texts.en:
T. Chantsal is a widow and lives with her three children in Uvurhanghay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Her two daughters both study in a local college and secondary school.

Chantsal moved from the Selenge province with her family in 2006 after her husband's death. Since the move, she has been running a small business selling clothes. In 2008, she rented a small stall in the local clothing market and started selling women’s and men's clothing.

Chantsal usually purchases clothing from Ereen, a Chinese border town from which many products are imported. She travels to Ereen to buy her inventory once or twice a month, depending on her sales volume.

Chantsal’s hope is to see her daughters finish college without any financial strain. She has always dreamed of making her own clothes instead of reselling others’. She requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing from Ereen, China to sell

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam has been a clothing seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Sote Tushikamane group (Group code 2002).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $65. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money and get more food for her family.  


Zamzam is 50, is married, and has nine  children: the first eight children are aged 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 18, 16, 11 (she was unable to provide the ninth child's age). She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase and sale of fruit and vegetables, cloth, and shoes

loans.name: Lisialan

texts.en:
Lisialan V. D. Z. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  Lisialan is a cheerful, welcoming and outgoing woman.  She sells cooked food from her home during lunchtime and in the evenings. She also sells colorful knitted clothes, bags and decorative pieces.  

Lisialan has been working with Manuela Ramos since 1998.  She will invest this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles in knitting materials and in food for her home-based restaurant.  Lisialan chose a lower amount for this current loan because she wants to be sure that she can make her loan payments on time.    

Lisialan is 53 and is a single parent to her 19-year-old son.  She is trying to deciD. what to do next in life.  Things have gone well for Lisialan in her involvement with Manuela Ramos.  Through her loans and the growth of her business ventures, Lisialan has been able to expand her house and fix up the few rooms that she rents out to tenants.

loans.use: To purchase knitting materials and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Amamah

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1998, son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle en maîtrise la gestion. Son stock a baissé et ne lui permet pas de subvenir de façon convenable aux besoins de ses clients. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs d’haricots et 1 sac de cossèques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns her living by selling cereals. She began this business in 1998, and her long years of experience make her a knowledgeable businesswoman. Her inventory is down which does not allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele appropriately. She wants to replenish her stocks and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 4 sacks of maize, 4 sacks of dried beans, and 1 sack of "cossèques".

She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, etc. for resale

loans.name: Polieni

texts.en:
Polieni F. owns and operates a general store selling food products in her community. She is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Falevao. She is married and has nine adult children. Polieni has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2004, Polieni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Polieni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.

Polieni is now requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fifth loan from SPBD. Polieni plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.(0)

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar Pantalones de mujer, Blusas, camisolines, trajes con chaquetas, pantaletas, tanga scorpiño y shorts de mujer.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou Mbacké SYLLA est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle fait de l’élevage et de la vente de bétail. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt renforcer son activité et avec les revenus générés subvenir aux dépenses familiales quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Fatou M. SYLLA is 42 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. She does livestock farming and sells cattle. She would like to strengthen her business with this loan and to meet the daily family expenses with the income generated.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of cattle and livestock farming

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita P. is a 41-year-old married woman from South Cotabato. She and her husband were blessed with four children to love and take care of. Lolita is into rice farming. She owns one hectare of rice field. Aside from that, she also manages a sari-sari store where she spends her time while waiting for harvest. Right now, Lolita’s business is doing well. A member of CEVI for more than two years now, she particularly likes the Savings and Insurance program and also the low interest rate offered. To maintain her business, Lolita requests a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. This loan will be used to finance her farm and also to buy inventory for the store that she owns.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 07  hijos, vive en el Sector Central, estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, es una de las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, ella luego los vende en la feria semanal, La señora Josefa también elaborar productos  de artesanía en tejido a palito.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is a 46-year-old farmer. He tills his land for rice crops. He has been married to Julie for 16 years. Their five children are still young. The eldest is only 15 years old. Danilo dreams that all his children will finish schooling and have a better future. That is why he makes sure to manage his farming business well. He sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines, and applied for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. He will use this loan to buy the inputs he needs, like fertilizers and seeds. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile to Danilo because if his harvest is good, he will have a good income as well and can even save for his children’s future.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Guembe Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento GUEMBE esta en su  1er. ciclo, todas las socias se conocen desD. hace años. Sra. Revodia es la presidenta del grupo ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, actividad que la realiza en su propio domicilio;  su esposo es chofer asalariado, pero tambien le colabora a la esposa atendiendoesta la pension.El crédito solicitado es para invertir en su negocio D. la venta D. comida su deseo D. la señora es ampliar su restaurante.
Sra. Elizabeth, es la tesorera del banco D. emprendimiento, es madre soltera con dos bellos niños, que aun estan en edad escolar; se dedica a la venta D. joyas y ropa trabaja como ambulante, el crédito solicitado lo invirtió comprando mercadería que por las fiestas D. fin D. año sus pedidos se incrementaran. 
Sra.- Glady, es la secretaria del banco D. emprendimiento, es casada con cuatro hijos, el esposo es albañil contratista, que se desplaza D. pueblo en pueblo; ella se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos la señora desea crecer en su negocio y comprar un puesto.La cliente esta agradecida por al apoyo brindado por la institución.
texts.en:
The GUEMBE enterprising bank is in its first cycle. All the members have known each other for many years. Revodia is the group's president and sells prepared food from her home; her husband is a salaried driver but also helps his wife tend to her guests. The financing is to invest in her meal selling business; her wish is to enlarge her restaurant. Elizabeth is the bank's treasurer. She is a single mother of two beautiful, school-age, children. She is a traveling salesperson of jewelry and clothing. The funds requested were invested in the purchase of merchandise since her orders over the holiday season will increase. Glady, the group secretary, is married and has four children. Her husband is a bricklayer contractor who goes from town to town. She sells cosmetics and wants to increase her business and buy a sales stall. She is grateful for the help the institution has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Juana Alejandrina

texts.es: Juana tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y  vive en casa propia ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña.  Su conyugue  se encuentra laborando como maestro de obra fuera de la ciudad donde le gira de manera semanal el monto de S/.150 para cubrir los gastos en la unidad familiar. Tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad los cuales cuentan con familia y apoyan a sus padres de manera economica. No cuenta con carga familiar. Posee casa propia de material de concreto con acumulacion de bienes.  La Sra. Juana  su mayor  esperanza es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Su actividad principal y de mayor rentabilidad es la venta de ropa solo para damas.Se incicio en este negocio mas de 20 años. Su primer punto de venta estaba ubicado en la calle Amazonas como ambulante.Debido al desalojo por la municipalidad fue reuvicada en la calle Lambayeque donde actualmente funciona su negocio.  Solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia por campaña navideña para surtir su mercaderia  de ropa para damas.
texts.en:
Juana, 67, is married and lives in her own house in the Tinguiña district. Her spouse works as a construction site supervisor in another city; he sends her 150 soles per week to cover household expenses. They have two adult children who have their own families but they help out their parents economically. She does not have children to support. She owns her own concrete house with its equity. Juana's greatest wish is that her children become professionals and have a better quality of life. Her main and most profitable activity is selling womens' clothing. She started this line of work over 20 years ago. Her first point of sales location was a sales stand on Amazonas Street. The city evicted her from that location and relocated her to Lambayaque street where she currently operates. She requests financing to buy merchandise to stock up on womens' clothing for the Holiday shopping season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on womens' clothes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing, 40, sells melons at retail prices and has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits.  Her profits from her business feed her family.  Blessing is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more melon to sell.  Her husband is a blacksmith. She is married with four children.  She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more melon to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn G. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 40 years old. Arlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a business buying and selling coconuts. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconuts in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
la joven Ana Cristina M. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Puente San Lorenzo Valle.
se dedica la venta de productos de la canasta basica familiar, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. ahorita necesita capital para surtir su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son bastantes y los carros repartidores de productos pasan solo una vez por semana y otros cada dos semanas, hay veces que se queda sin producto y tiene que esperar hasta que pasen de nuevo, esto la hace perder ganancias.
se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien con su negocio que es propio.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina M. is 23 years old and lives in the village of Puente San Lorenzo Valle. She sells basic necessity products from a store she operates in her home. Ana is requesting a loan because she needs capital to restock her business and meet the demands of her customers, of which she has many. Some of the distribution trucks that bring her products only come by only once a week, while others come every two weeks. Ana sometimes runs out of merchandise, so she has to wait until a new shipment is delivered, which causes her to lose profits. She is very happy because everything is going well with her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy vive en la zona  25 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto, en su casita propia.

Trabaja como albañil de manera independiente en diferentes zonas de la ciudad y su esposa trabaja como educadora de un colegio de la zona. Todos sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar.
  
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de medicamentos para una de sus pequeñas hijas la cual se encuentra delicada de salud.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo que va vía Kiva, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in the “25 de julio” (25 of July) zone of El Alto in his own cottage. He works independently as a bricklayer in different areas of the city, and his wife works as a teacher in a neighborhood high school. All their children are of school age.

The loan will be used for the purchase of medications for one of their small daughters who is experiencing health problems. This his second loan with Impro and the second obtained through Kiva. He is rated as qualified to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medications for one of his daughters who has health problems.

loans.name: Has Lo Justo Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina” Has lo Justo “ están en el Quinto Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un ahorro de gs 3.575.470 gs.
Cada una de las integrantes retira un monto para destinar a la actividad al cual se dedica. Por ejemplo la Señora Clotilde Martiñez Quien abrió una despensa después de formar parte del comité, y actualmente le va muy bien tiene muchos clientes y nos comenta que ayuda mucho con los gastos de la casa. 
A la señora nos ayuda Clotilde tiene varios hijos quienes le ayudan a ella para atender la despensa y así ella también realiza las labores de la casa.
Se citan las actividades que las demás integrantes realizan:

loans.use: Purchasing staple goods: rice, sugar, flour, oil, fruits, vegetables, meats, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Alapo

texts.en: Alapo is a 55-year-old married man with four children. His children are making progress in their business and school. He sells drinks at retail prices to his customers. He has a bar where he sells drinks. Business is very good for Alapo in the evenings because it is the time when his customers get together to drink and chat after the day’s job. He loves this business because he does not sell on credit to his customers. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to make more profits. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2003, Julita has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly center meetings and solid repayments on previous loans. She is grateful to the ASHI-Kiva partnership for support of all of her dreams and the challenges in life. Julita is 65 years old. Her husband, Darico, is a farmer and works closely with her. To have a stable income for her family, Julita has been running a farming business for almost 10 years. Julita would like to obtain a loan amounting to 20,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional materials for her business, including palay (rice seeds), insecticides, other supplies and labor expenses. Julita believes that the loan will help to grow her farming business and drive increased revenue. Her dreams are to maintain the productivity of her business and to build a concrete and durable home. Julita is hopeful that her farming business ventures will continue to grow and improve her overall standard of living and help her move away from the umbrella of poverty. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the most poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business, including palay (rice seeds), insecticides, other supplies and labor expenses.

loans.name: Karina Ruth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserio Rama Tepo, una zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace ocho meses a la venta de abarrotes en general en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio es importante porque le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia ya que, como su padre trabaja en la agricultura, necesitan de una actividad que les brinde recursos permanentes para poder salir adelante.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida gracias a la calidad de trato que ofrece y a que la bodega les provee de productos de consumo diario que no pueden obtener facilmente ya que la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del pueblo más cercano.

Karina desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Karina es una joven responsable y que gusta mucho de la actividad que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the village of Rama Tepo, a rural area in the District of Mochumí, Lambayeque Province. This community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past eight months, Karina has been selling groceries from a store she established in her home. This business is important because it provides the necessary income to cover her personal expenses and support her family. Her father works in agriculture, but they need an activity that provides a stable income so that they can get ahead.

Karina’s business has been well-received thanks to the quality of service that she provides. Her store provides daily consumer products that are not readily available in the area because they live far away from the nearest town.

Karina wants to expand her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of groceries and achieve her objective. Karina is a responsible young woman who enjoys her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a trustworthy person. Karina's greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Progress Family Group

texts.en:
Thomas T. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Progress Family. He is 45 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 28 years old. He was not privileged to attend school. For 7 years, Thomas has been selling hardware like cutlasses, door locks, and keys at the Via Town market in Monrovia. He sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning. He started his business with 1,000 Liberian dollars. Thomas plans to use his 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 22,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cutlasses, nails, locks, and keys. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Thomas is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more cutlasses, nails, locks, and keys

loans.name: Meiry

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MEIRY,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera,  Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la docencia, ella es profesora de inicial del jardín niño Jesus de Praga; y complementando sus actividades  ella cría animales menores; sólo para pasar su tiempo libre ocupada. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar animalitos (pollitos).

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
MEIRY, 24, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is single and works as a teacher at the Jesus de Praga kindergarten; she also raises small farm animals to have something to do in her spare time. She needs funding to buy chicks. She is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Salvina

texts.en:
Salvina Q. is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fishing and fish-vending business. She lives in Brgy Olympia, Bais City, Negros Oriental, with her 39-year-old husband, Joselito. They have three children aged between 6 and 14, all of whom are currently in school.
Salvina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP.
Salvina is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to buy materials for her fishing business and as additional working capital for the business. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and as working capital

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, es un hombre trabajador que tiene 50 años, vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos de los cuatro que tiene. Él esta separado de su pareja, desde hace 3 años, aún así no deja de estar pendiente de ella. Casi sin descanso, labora a diario, en su chacra, en busca de un futuro mejor para sus hijos; pues continua apoyándoles económicamente, es por eso que desde muy temprano empieza su jornada laboral, en donde cuenta con hectáreas extensas donde produce café, plátano, frutas cítricas, cacao y achiote. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo, quien inspecciona cuidadosamente las plantaciones. Lo que más le gusta a Roberto, es retirar la maleza de sus chacras y así mantenerlos limpios, también le agrada poner trampas para que los animales no malogren sus cosechas y las pueda vender a buenos precios en el mercado de su ciudad, porque los frutos que produce son muy requeridos y por tal considera que su actividad es muy rentable. En adelante quiere ser uno de los mejores productores de cacao, bananas y café para poder obtener mayores utilidades que le favorezcan. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de plantas de plátanos para plantarlas en 3 hectáreas de terreno que recientemente compró.
texts.en:
Roberto is a hard-working man who is 50 years old. He lives in his own house with two of his four children. He has been separated from his wife for three years, although he is still dependent on her. Almost without rest, he works every day in his small farm, in search of a better future for his children, as he continues to support them economically. It is for this reason he begins his daily work very early, in which he has extensive hectares where he produces coffee, bananas, citrus fruits, cocoa, and annatto (makes a red paste used in cooking for color and flavor).

On occasion he receives the help of his son, who carefully inspects the plants. What Roberto likes most is to pull out the weeds from his farm and likewise keep them clean. Also he likes to put traps out so that the animals don't spoil his harvests, and he can sell them at good prices in the market in his city. The fruits that he produces are highly demanded and as such, he considers his business very profitable. Going forward, he wants to be one of the biggest producers of cocoa, bananas and coffee in order to be able to earn greater profits.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is sure that he can complete each payment punctually, as he did with his first loan. Additionally, he likes to work with his commnity bank. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest it in the purchase of banana plants to plant them in three hectares of land that he recently bought.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana plants

loans.name: Mrs. Yan Yorng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yan Y. is a 29 year old married woman. She is the village bank president, having been selected by the group's eight members, located in Ta Koem village, in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Yan Y. and her husband, Mr. Vutdy Uy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they are also silk weavers at home who are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. For silk weaving, Mrs. Yan Y. decide to ask for a loan to buy more yarns to support her silk weaving. The rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets for her new business. This couple has three children: two are students in the local school while another one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more yarns to support her silk weaving.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de fruits et laitues, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s'approvisionne à Lomé, elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock raison pour laquelle elle demande un prêt pour l'achat de divers fruits comme l'avocat, les mangues, les papayes, la salade, des oranges et autres pour s'approvisionner. elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants
texts.en:
This lady earns her living with her retail business of fruit and lettuce; she has been doing this business since 2006 and gets her supplies at Lome. She is currently facing a stock outage, which is why she asked for a loan in order to purchase various fruits such as avocados, mangos, papayas, lettuce, oranges and others to stock up. She is married and mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
Yolen S. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolen farms rice and has been doing so for over 5 years. She also raises hogs now to earn extra income.  Yolen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting her 4th loan, for 12000 PHP, to purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for the pigs.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.es:
Ambrocio vive en la comunidad de Cajamarca en el distrito de Chimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposa. La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Ambrocio se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ambrocio por las tardes y las mañanas se encarga de pastear, ordeña a los animales.  Ambrocio y su esposa tienen varias chacras donde producen maíz, papa y ellos llevan a vender sus productos a las ferias y a los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Ambrocio que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Ambrocio pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Ambrocio lives with his wife in the community of Cajamarca in Cachimayo within the Anta province of Cusco, Peru. Cachimayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Ambrocio works in livestock and agriculture. He has worked in this business for 20 years and does very well. In the mornings and evenings Ambrocio must graze and milk the animals. Ambrocio and his wife have several farms where they grow corn and potatoes. They sell their products at fairs and markets in the city of Cusco. With his next loan, Ambrocio hopes to receive USD 200. He would like to use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer. The community bank “Señor de Qoylluriti Cachimayo” has been in operation for three and a half years. Ambrocio has belonged to the bank for three years and has been doing well. The members are the bank are devotees of Taytacha Qoylluriti (Lord of Shining Show) so they named the bank as such.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds & fertilizer

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a single mom. She has a 9-year-old daughter, Dominika. Monika lives and runs her small enterprise in the town of Beregovo, western Ukraine. She owns a vending facility in a local shopping center called "Image." She sells women’s clothing items and shoes. Monika started this business two years ago. Currently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Monika is very customer-friendly. She is known for her polite attitude to clients. She resupplies her inventory on a regular basis. Monika is hoping to use a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing and footwear merchandise for further retail sale in her outlet.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Seteer

texts.en:
Seteer A. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent known locally as a ger. His oldest son currently studies at a local university and his 5-year-old daughter is in kindergarten. He and his wife both receive monthly retirement benefits from the government totaling 320,000 MNT, but their main household income comes from their vegetable-trading business. 

Seteer has two fields totaling 6 hectares, where he grows a variety of vegetables, as well as a 2-hectare field for hay. Seteer started his vegetable-trading business in 2004. Due to the short growing season and long winters in Mongolia, Seteer preserves most of his vegetables through the winter and sells them in the spring when demand is high. He has an underground storage facility that he built in his yard. During the fall and winter months, he purchases vegetables from other farmers that he resells. 

Seteer is a very open-minded and hardworking person. He says, "Generally, my vegetable output is enough to cover my household consumption, however, this year's harvest was very low. Next year I plan to plant more so I will have a surplus to sell"

Seteer  is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 3 tons of carrots and 2 tons of beets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase three tons of carrots and two tons of beets

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a married woman with two girls and one boy aged 15,13, and 9 years respectively. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Rahel has operated her food-selling business (samosas and deep fried potatoes) in an open air market for over five years. Her main customers are passersby and the neighbouring community. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, as the price of potatoes fluctuates with the seasons. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 requested, she wants to purchase a freezer to make juices and store samosas.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer to make juices and store samosas

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa B. is a 40-year-old and lives with her husband and adult daughter in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They own 100 livestock and her husband herds their own cattle in the countryside. Tsevelmaa operates a dairy products business in a rented stall at the central market in her town. She started her business in 2002 after moving from countryside and has made much progress with her business over the years. Today her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. Tsevelmaa uses her earnings to support her family and she has purchased fence in 2002 and car in 2006 for her family with her business profits. She is planning to expand her business for the future. Tsevelmaa is a friendly and open minded woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products at wholesale price to sell through the tsagaan sar, a Mongolian new year, when the products will be in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for sale

loans.name: Nyume

texts.en:
Nyume P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. 

Nyume is 33 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 49 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture), is requesting a loan for her husband's fruit vending business. Her husband, M. Y., buys fresh fruits from the fruit markets at cheap rates and then sells them in different areas of the community from his four-wheel cart. People come to buy fruits from him because of their freshness and good quality. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantities and increase his sales. Nasreen is confident that this loan investment will be beneficial for her husband and for the family, and that he will be able to lift up his business successfully by increasing his sales to many more customers. 
 
They have three sons, two of whom work. The youngest, age 15, still lives at home. The family lives in a city named Sahiwal in Pakistan. Nasreen and her husband couldn’t provide education facilities to her children due to their limited financial resources. The children left their school after completing fifth grade.
 
Nasreen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia L. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Media Once, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Cake Processing and Food Vending. Her husband Camilo L., who is 59 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living. They have two children who are 24 and 30 years old. Virgenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virgenia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use for additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future renovation of their house. Virgenia L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a fifty-eight-year-old widow with seven children, and owns a house in Kasese. She has been selling stationary for seven years. She started with a typewriter but now has a photocopier and computer. Her business challenges include high rent and constant power fluctuations. Her vision is to connect to the internet and make her business into a bookstore.

loans.use: To buy stationary

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 34-year-old mother of three who lives with her family in the rural community of Sarapiqui, Heredia, located in the heart of Costa Rica. 

Viviana is a hardworking woman who has taken it upon herself to engage in a revenue-generating activity to complement the salary she earns working at a local fruit-producing multinational corporation. The company Viviana works for employs many mothers in the area but only offers part-time positions and seasonal, contract work. As a result, the salaries earned by laborers are low, hardly enough to support a family: 150,000 Colones per month (roughly $300).  

Viviana makes up for the low salary she earns by selling various products to members of her community, many of whom she works with. She plans to use this loan to make investments in merchandise such as shoes, clothing and perfumes, which she hopes to sell before Christmas. The loan consultant that has been working with Viviana describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur who has demonstrated her ability to make punctual repayments. 

Viviana has been selling merchandise over the past three years; she has secured a base of regular clients and her business is expanding. Her main obstacle at the moment is a lack of access to working capital. In order to satisfy the existing demands of her clients, she must make merchandise purchases up front, so that she can make sales to her clients on credit. This loan will help to address this obstacle. 

In the mornings, Viviana works at the Tropifrost while her mother takes care of the children. In the afternoons, Viviana is dedicated to her business, making sales, collecting repayments or purchasing merchandise.

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes, clothing and perfumes

loans.name: Samjella

texts.en:
Samjella E. F. was born in 1967. He is married and the father of four children, all below the age of 15. He and his family share three rooms in Njianga Quarters, in Nsongwa village mile 90 Bamenda, North West Region, Cameroon.

E. has encountered a lot of difficulties in life, the most profound being the death of his parents while he was still very young. As a result, he was unable to educate himself nor to have three square meals a day. Ill health has also been one of his problems. He has been unable to have good medical treatment because he has no money. Since he has joined GHAPE, he has seen the following changes in his life: sending his children to school, affording three square meals a day for his family, encouraging capital for his business and paying his hospital bills without a lot of difficulty.

With this loan of 200,000 XAF, E. will increase his capital and buy farm tools, piglets and pig feed. The manure from the pigs will be used to farm vegetables, some of which he will sell. His community and family will benefit from the vegetables, manure and meat when the pigs are edible. His activity will help reduce distance from members of his community and will be available at all times. E. says, “My children will all be well educated.” He will use the profit from his business to educate his children, increase his capital and provide basic needs for himself and for his family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training and follow-up he frequently receives. He appreciates that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities and that it provides low cost loans, with gradual payments. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy farm tools, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Teodoro Silvestre

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 53 años con 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es venta de productos lácteos, por lo que él siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante ya que tiene una familia que mantener, cuando el inicio este trabajo no tenía suficiente capital de trabajo, pero con la ayuda y la confianza que ha logrado alcanzar sus objetivos. Es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para la compra de cuajada, crema, leche, queso y leche agria. Su deseo es seguir trabajando duro para proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 53 years old and has three dependent children in his care. He engages in the sale of dairy products and is always looking for ways to get ahead since he has a family to support. When he started working he did not have enough operating capital, but with help and trust Teodoro has been able to achieve his goals.

He has decided to use this loan to buy curds, cream, milk, cheese, and sour milk. Teodoro hopes to continue working hard so that he can provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase curds, cream, milk, cheese, and sour milk

loans.name: Casimera

texts.es: Casimera, es una dulce mujer de 54 años. Enviudo hace 10 años, pero a pesar de ello cuidó de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Las trabajadoras manos de Casimera, sostienen el pellejo de un cordero, con el cual se pueden hacer tapices, e incluso lo utilizan para sacar lana muy gruesa, que sirve para abrigarse del frío que asota en la zona alta del Perú. Asimismo las 4 vacas que posee, le sirven para poder sacar leche y elaborar queso.  Ella conserva aún el espíritu trabajador, de todo aquel que vive en el campo. Ya tiene 30 años dedicándose a la agricultura, sus cultivos constan de lechuga, papa, maíz y arveja, productos que cuidan con mucho esmero, salvando sus sembríos de la plaga y fertilizándolos constantemente. Sus proyectos en adelante es sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues le agrada su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP,  donde siente el apoyo incondicional de los integrantes de su asociación. Casimera, muy pronto cosechará sus cultivos de maíz o llamado también “choclo”. Por ello con el crédito está pensando invertir en la compra de semillas de lechuga y espinaca, los cuales esparcirá después de esta cosecha.
texts.en:
Casimera is a sweet woman who is 54 years old. Despite becoming a widow ten years ago, she has been able to take care of her six children. Two of her children live in their own homes in the village of Pongo. The hardworking hands of Casimera make rugs out of sheep skins. Even the coarsest wool can be used to protect oneself from the frigid cold that invades the upper area of Peru. Casimera has four cows from which she is able to get milk for making cheese. She maintains a working spirit that is possessed by everyone who lives in the area. Casimera has been farming for thirty years. Her crops consist of lettuce, potatoes, corn, and peas. She looks after her crops with great care, protects them from pests, and fertilizes them constantly. Her plans going forward include increasing her plantings because she enjoys her work.

Casimera is a member of the Communal Bank “Paraíso al Progress” (Paradise to Progress) and receiving her third loan from MFP. She receives unconditional support from the other members of the association. Casimera will soon harvest her crop of corn, a variety called “choclo”. Her loan will be invested in the purchase seeds for growing lettuce and spinach which she will plant after this harvest.

loans.use: Purchase lettuce & spinach seeds

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwaka has operated a business selling firewood for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwaka faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

Mwaka is planning to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Herminio, de 47 años, es un hombre dedicado al cuidado de su familia. Que lo conforman su esposa Juana, y sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Desde que cumplió 19 años, esté exitoso hombre se dedicó a la agricultura. Desde ese entonces comenzó a sembrar papa, maíz y arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas que tiene en la parte alta de su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver concretado su esfuerzo en cada cosecha que realiza, pues recibe buen pago en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según menciona su principal dificultad es el dinero que invierte en los estudios de sus hijos. Por eso necesita capital de trabajo para poder sembrar sin mayores dificultades, ahora está pensando sembrar después de la cosecha, arveja en gran cantidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Palqueños en acción”, y este es tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado por el progreso que alcanzó en su trabajo. Herminio, cosechará papa de la variedad yungay; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos para que le brinden un buen producto.
texts.en:
Herminio is a 47 year old gentleman who is devoted to taking care of his family. He and his wife Juana have six children, but only two live with them in their home in the town of Palca. After he turned 19, this successful man decided to become a farmer. Herminio began growing corn, potatoes, and peas on the farmland he owns in the upper district of his community. What he enjoys most about his work is seeing his efforts materialize at the end of each harvest since he is paid well at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. According to Herminio, his main difficulty is investing his money in his children’s education. For this reason, he needs operating capital to plant his crops without major difficulty. Now he will begin planting after this harvest in which he produced peas in great quantity.

Herminio is a member of the Communal Bank “Plaqueños en Acción”. This is his third loan with MFP. He feels that he has developed and progressed in what he has accomplished through his work. Herminio will be harvesting potatoes of the “Yungay” variety. For this reason, he plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on his crops so that he can achieve a good product.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador, de 36 años vive en concubinato hace 14 años con Rosina. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los cuales quieren y protegen en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huasahuasi. La siembra de papa, arveja, flor de gladiolo y habas, es su principal actividad económica. El cual siembra en terrenos que alquila anualmente, ya tiene 18 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo aprendió todas las técnicas de cultivo por ello obtiene buenas ganancias en cada cosecha que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Su principal dificultad es la falta de apoyo, pues tiene que contratar peones para que le ayuden a mantener y cuidar sus cultivos, por ello está pensando invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de hortalizas y arveja. Donde podré obtener ganancias diarias, pues venderá al menudeo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibió en todo este tiempo. Amador, invertirá en compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de arveja, asimismo comprará verduras por kilos para comenzar su negocio de venta por unidad.
texts.en:
36-year old Amador has lived common-law with his partner Rosina for fourteen years. They have three children whom they take care of in their own home located in Huasahuasi. Amador grows potatoes, peas, gladioli flowers, and beans on land that he rents on an annual basis. He has 18 years experience so has learned all there is to know about farming. Each harvest brings in a good profit when he sells the produce in the wholesale market in town. 

The main difficulty that Amador faces is the lack of help. He has to hire labourers to help him look after his fields. For this reason he is thinking of investing in a business to buy and sell garden produce and peas. He would be able to earn more money by selling at retail prices.

Amador belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank. This is his seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is grateful for all the support he has received over the years. He plans to use this loan to buy several sacks of manure to spread on his fields of peas. He will also buy vegetables and start his new vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: to buy manure and vegetables for his new business

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
T. T. P. is 30 years old with two children who are at  high school and secondary school. 

She has run a tailoring shop for four years and it strongL. developed when she was abL. to invest in one more sewing machine in 2010. CurrentL., she can make 3,500,000 VND profit per month. 

Joining with  our program in 2009, she has been a good group leader. For this new cycL. loan, she wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy clothes to sew.

Hang T. N. is 47 years old with two children. She  is running a small grocery shop right in her house. She needs to have 7,194,000 VND to buy more products to sell. 

Ngan T. P. is 31 years old with two children. She is running a shop that sells soup for babies. She wants to have 654,000 VND to buy ingredients.

Lam T. L. is 47 years old. Being a farmer, she breeds three cows for milk. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 to improve the house for them.

La T. L. is 43 years old. She is raising seven pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

He T. N. is 45 years old. She has a small shop that sells fresh vegetables in the local market. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in this shop.

Duong T. T.  D. is 42 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Hugo Zacarias

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 57 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos ya están casados y dos aún dependen él.
Se dedica al micro-comercio, posee un vehículo con el cual sale a hacer sus ventas por las zonas de la Cordillera (tercer departamento del Paraguay que comprende varias ciudades) y una vez por semana hacia la zona de San Pedro (segundo departamento del Paraguay ubicado en la frontera).
Cuenta con clientela formada desde hace casi 2 años, tiempo que inició su dedicación al macate o venta ambulante.
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de embutidos y golosinas, pues con esto aumentará su stock y posibilitará la satisfacción de gran parte de su demanda, podrá mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 57 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of his children are already married and the other two are still dependent on him.

Hugo has a micro business.  He owns a vehicle which he uses to make his sales in areas of Cordillera (a department - administrative area - which is made up of several cities).  Once a week he travels to San Pedro (a neighboring department).  He has had an established customer base for almost two years which is when he started work as a traveling salesman.

Hugo will use his loan to buy cold meats and soda as this will enable him to increase his stock and meet a large part of his demand.  He will be able to improve his income which he uses to cover the basic needs of his family and his children's university expenses.

loans.use: to buy cold meats and soda

loans.name: Melva Rosa

texts.es:
Melva de 18 años de edad, es soltera, vive en Casa alquilada que cuenta con agua y luz solamente desde hace 1 año, ubicada en Villa Hermosa, la cual pertenece al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, que queda en la provincia de Chivclayo.  Provincia donde sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio al por mayor y menor de productos comestibles, agricultura y turismo.
Melva se dedica a la venta de plantas de diferentes especies y maceteros de diferentes formas y tamanños, atividad que realiza desde hace 2años  al frente del mercado Modelo, donde el flujo de clientes es variado.  Este negocio le permite a Melva tener ingresos económicos diarios que han ido creciendo poco a poco, permitiéndole de alguna manera poder solventar sus gastos.
A solicitado Melva un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más plantas y maceteros, para que siga creciendo su negocio y ella pueda tener la oportunidad de sguir algunos estudios superiores en un futuro cercano; un sueño que anhela mucho, el cual lo conseguirá con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en: Melva is 18 years old, single, and she has been living in a rental house equipped only with running water and hydro for the past year. It is located in Villa Hermosa, belonging to the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz of the province of Chiclayo. The population of this province is primarily involved in commerce, both in wholesale and retail of food products, in agriculture, and in tourism. Melva sells plants of different species and pots in different forms and sizes. This business has helped Melva earn a daily income, one which has been increasing gradually, and to cover her expenses. Melva has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she will use it to purchase more plants and pots to keep her business growing. This will give her the opportunity to take some post-secondary courses. It is a dream which she wants most, one which she will achieve with effort and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase plants and pots.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her daughter and mother in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a local secondary school and her mother helps with the family business. Enhtsetseg manages a grocery trading business, which she started in 2002. The store is located in her own property. In order to supplement her earnings, she has started to sell clothing as well as her groceries. Now Enhtsetseg is responsible for selling clothing and her mother is responsible for selling grocery items. Enhtsetseg is a polite woman who possesses great experience and knowledge. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more stylish and modern clothes for all ages for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish and modern clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose F. es de Mollejones, y es conocido por ser una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora.
El se dedica a la agricultura y desde poco ha tenido muchos problemas con su  vivienda, Ya que hubo un deslizamiento de tierra muy cerca de su casa. Es por eso que necesita pagar la mano de obra para votar  la gran cantidad de tierra que cayó en frente de si casa. Para eso necesitara un préstamo de ₡300 000  (Trescientos mil colones). El está muy agradecido ya que este tipo de instituciones siempre están Disponibles cuando uno lo necesita. 
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose F. is from Mollejones and is known as an enterprising and hard-working person.
He is a farmer and  lately has started having problems with his house since there was a landslide very nearby.  That is the reason he needs to pay for labor to move the large amount of mud that landed in front of his house.  He is requesting a loan of 300 thousand colones.  Juan F. is very grateful for this type of institution that is always ready to help when needed.
He is a member of the Bancruce communal bank, one of the 110 branches of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To protect against landslides

loans.name: Rosas De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Mercedes es secretaria. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de comida, trabajo en minas, venta de cosméticos, atención en Internet, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, atención de fotocopias, venta de ropa usada.

La señora Mercedes,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de tienda de barrio, que inicio hace seis meses atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería para su tienda (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, verduras, etc.), estos productos los comprará de la ciudad de El Alto y los venderá todos los días en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas de Chijini" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer; they meet in the central office of Villa Adela.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors; Mercedes is the secretary.  The women in the group have a variety of economic activities, including: clothing sales, food sales, working in a quarry, cosmetic sales, Internet services, neighborhood store, photocopies, and used clothing sales.

Mercedes says that this is the first loan cycle that she has been with Pro Mujer; she joined the organization by invitation.  Now she has a neighborhood store that she started 6 months ago.

She will use the loan that she will take to buy merchandise for her store (noodles, rice, cooking oil, vegetables, etc.)  She will buy these products in the city of El Alto and she will sell them every day in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family; she contributes as much as she can to her household which includes her common-law husband and their 2 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a widow taking care of two children. For the past seven years, she has been selling cosmetics, blouses and kente clothes at Abura. The income she is able to raise from the sale of these goods is used to educate her children. She wishes to increase her business and so needs a loan of 800 GHS to be able to buy more cosmetics to sell. Her future plan is to build a shop for the business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12. Her husband is a driver, and all of their children are in school. 

For three years, Beatha has been successfully selling honey. She will use this loan to purchase more honey that she can sell to meet the growing demand of her customers. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and begin saving for the future of herself and her family. As a business woman, she aspires to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy honey for sale.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (pictured above) and her husband, Chanthorn, live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two married daughters. One lives in separated home and another one still lives in family home. 

Yat is a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working entrepreneur who makes and sells food in the Philippines. Vilma has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from selling meat. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: La Sra. Abigail   desea utilizar su crédito para realizar su proyecto, el  cual  consite  en  colocar   la  losa   a  un cuarto  que   poco a  poco  a  ido  construyendo, pero  por   falta  de capital  no  había  concluido  la  realización de su proyecto, Abigail esta  muy  contenta   en habernos  encontrado  ya  que  gracias  a nuestro  a apoyo  podrá brindarle  a  su   familia  una  mayor comodidad , agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sra. Abigail wants a loan so that she can carry out her plans, which include laying down a slab in a room that has been in a gradual process of construction. However, she lacks the capital needed to complete this project.

Abigail is pleased to have found the support of Credituyo so that she can provide her family greater comfort. She is grateful for the assistance that has been provided so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to lay down a slab in her home.

loans.name: Madi

texts.fr:
Mr Madi. est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 6ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.

Il vend une boutique de vêtements prêts à porter pour hommes et femmes depuis 05ans. Mr s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les jeunes.

Mr veut s’acheter 20 pantalons, 15 ensembles vestes et des chaussures.

Il économise pour la scolarité de ses enfants et construire sa maison d’habition. Mr ambitionne agrandir sa boutique et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Madi is married and a father of two. The eldest is ten and the youngest is six. They both attend school. He has a total of four people in his care.

He has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for men and women in his store for five years. Mr. Madi gets his supplies from the market in sector ten. His customers are women, men and young people.

He wants to purchase 20 pairs of pants, 15 men suits and shoes.

He is saving for his children's school expenses and to build his house. Mr. Madi's ambition is to expand his store and to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of pants, 15 men suits and shoes.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 47 and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up a daughter and two sons; the younger son studies at school and the other children are at university. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Aigul sells fruits and vegetables. She started this activity eleven years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms and at the moment her monthly profit is 6000 soms per month.  

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.  Aigul will use some part of the loan to pay her daughter’s tuition at university. In the future she wants to give her children a good education and wishes to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 37 years old and her husband, Saroeun, is 46 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is married, one is a security guard and the other two are in school. 

Sreymom is a weaver and her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son, who is a security guard, to drive to work.

Photo: Sreymom is standing next to the motorcycle because she bought it but has not yet paid for it.  So she asks for the loan to pay for it.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is 47 years old. He is married and has three children. Bakhtiyar is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from raising large livestock, selling them at the local market and selling milk to the local people. Every year, Bakhtiyar buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises the heifers with the help of his wife and young son. He then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. His monthly income from this business is $270 US. 

Bakhtiyar is now thinking about expanding his business, since his present income isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase an additional cow, which requires an additional investment of 800 AZN in his business. Therefore, Bakhtiyar has applied for a loan from AqroInvest. This will be third loan from AqroInvest and he promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice’s group is comprised of three hard working women. Beatrice is 16-years-old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, soap and sugar for resale. This will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Beatrice's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has a business of selling breads in Yei, South Sudan, for the last four years.

Regina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda is 46 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Roseminda sells snacks to people in her village.  Roseminda earns about PHP 1,000 per month.  

Roseminda has requested a loan of 4000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Roseminda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.  

In the future, Roseminda would like to expand and sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 32-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of four and eighteen years. Three of them are in school. She has a business of selling food in a hotel in Kator, South Sudan for four years. Fatuma requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children in future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Fidel Atilio

texts.es:
Fidel, se encuentra solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues necesita fortalecer su taller y comprarse madera, barniz, pintura, para mantener en la carpintería y poder realizar los pedidos de los clientes.
Fidel tiene el compromiso de abastecer materiales el taller, porque le gusta agradar a los clientes, fabricando los muebles a su gusto y según la necesidad, él considera que este dinero le ayuda mucho para el negocio, para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel is asking for a new loan because he needs to strengthen his workshop and buy wood, varnish and paint to keep up with his carpentry and finish his customers' orders. 

Fidel needs supplies for his workshop because he likes to make his customers happy, making custom furniture for their taste and needs. He thinks this money will help him and his family a lot with the business.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish and paint.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 57 años y vive en el municipio de Santa Barbara. Tiene más de 40 años de estar con su esposo Guillermo, lo cual es comerciante y agricultor. Tiene 5 hijos mayores de 39, 36, 31, 28 y 23 años de edad. 

Maria se dedica a la confección y venta de dulces (colaciones) y pan casero. Le despertó el interés en poner este negocio un día en una feria. Ella comenzó vendiendo sus dulces en un club de amas de casa hace 20 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Desde este entonces comenzó a vender en todas las ferias del departamento de Santa Barbara. Trabaja 5 horas diarias elaborando los dulces y el pan. 

Solicitó este crédito de L12,000 para comprar materia prima como azúcar, colorantes, canastas, bolsas y palos. Ella espera aumentar su producción y así ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 57 years old and lives in the town of Santa Barbara. She has been with her husband Guillermo, a merchant and bricklayer, for more than 40 years. They have five grown children (ages 39, 36, 31, 28, and 23).

Maria prepares and sells sweets (cookies) and homemade bread. She woke up one day and wanted to start a business at the fair. Maria began selling sweets to a club of homemakers 20 years ago with the help of her husband. Since then, she began selling at all of the fairs held in the Department of Santa Barbara. She works five hours a day preparing sweets and bread.

Maria is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to buy supplies such as sugar, food coloring, baskets, bags, and serving sticks. She hopes to increase her production and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar, food coloring, baskets, bags, and serving sticks.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
