Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelson Idaval

texts.es: Nelson Idaval de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado lechero, tiene varios años de trabajar en este ámbito y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite siempre mantener una labor de calidad, el terreno está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todas los lugares aledaños, la ventaja más grande frente a su competencia es que ya tiene mucha clientela, gracias a que todo lo que vende es de calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre está a la orden de las personas que lo solicitan, se siente muy orgulloso de los resultados del negocio; Nelson es un hombre visionario que planea cumplir cada uno de sus objetivos, porque solo así alcanzara el éxito, una de sus más grandes metas es hacer crecer el negocio para ello invertirá en insumos para aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, una vaca lechera, etc. Nelson Idaval tiene buenas referencias de pago y es totalmente responsable confía en que cancelara la deuda, y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, una vaca lechera

loans.name: Redsela

texts.en:
Redisela, age 22, is unmarried and lives with her mother in Iringa District, Tanzania. Redisela is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers for 2.5 hours per week teaching local secondary school students life skills. 
To earn an income, Redisela is a tailor and seller of women’s clothes, including khanga and vitenge (African garments). She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing fabric and sewing materials. Redisela will renovate her shop and pay for household expenses with any profits.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
When Maria Guadalupe was young she was working as an employee in a general store and she knew how to manage this business well, so later this skill was very useful to her. She got married and had 4 sons, but unfortunately, 8 years ago her husband started to drink more frequently and he never could leave the alcohol. Maria Guadalupe or their sons could not rescue him. He lost his job and his family did not have enough income to survive, so at this moment Maria Guadalupe made a decision to start her own business to keep her family alive. As she already knew how to run a general store, she decided to open one. She needs a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and she offers to pay the loan back in 6 months. She also comments that all cash pay in merchandise will be better prices and she can obtain more income and grow.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

De joven María Guadalupe trabajo como empleada en una tienda, por lo que conoció el oficio, que mas tarde le seria útil para salir adelante. Resulta que se caso y tuvo 4 hijos pero desafortunadamente hace 8 años su esposo empezó a beber cada vez con más frecuencia hasta convertirse en una enfermedad de la que ni ella ni sus hijos lo han podido rescatar. Ante esta situación, perdió el empleo y la familia resintió en los ingresos familiares, fue cuando María Guadalupe orillada por la situación tomo la decisión de poner un negocio para poder sobrevivir, conociendo el oficio se inclino por la tienda de abarrotes. Ella trabaja en su casa, en la parte de entrada coloco anaqueles y estantería que ahora vende entre sus vecinos. Esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$475 para invertir en mercancías, piensa que lo puede pagar en 6 meses. Comenta que al comprar mercancía de contado pueden mejorarle el precio así ella obtendrá más ganancia y con esto poder seguir abasteciéndose.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba has over 6 years of experience in the retail trade. She is married and has 3 children. She is a beautiful and cheerful person, and she loves children very much. This is why she started her business of selling interesting children’s books. The turnover of her business is fast, because her trade place is located near two schools and her little clients can buy books any time. By the developing her business she has been able to expand her assortment by adding office and school supplies. In the future Matluba would like to buy some science books for children. She is requesting $600 to buy these books.

loans.use: Purchase of children books

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en: Almagul is a mother of 2 children. She is 46 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Almagul has 2 years of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is a talented young woman of thirty eight years of age. She runs a small retail shop business at her village. She has four children who are all attending school. Etevise believes that she can do better than she is now because her business is being backed up by her loan from S.P.B.D. She has quite tough competition but she never gives up because she wants her children to get a better education in order to get better future.

loans.use: To buy  mutton flaps, turkey tails, tinned fish, chicken legs, and other supplies for her shop

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S., 33, lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at home selling vegetables and dried yam, earning on average about $2/day of profit, while her husband works for a private company as a driver and generally makes around $5/day. Mrs. Oun S. has recently applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to assist in her business transportation and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory. She believes the motor-bike will not only help to save her family from extra expenses, but it can make her business more productive, faster and effective.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to help grow her grocery business.

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Married and the father of four children, Mr. Folly H. was born on April 17, 1967. He lives in Djidjolé, a district of the capital, Lomé, with his wife, who does not work outside the home. He drives a motorcycle taxi. Presently, his motorcycle is broken and is not in working condition, but he does not have the means to buy another. Faced with this difficult situation, he is obliged to help out a friend who has a mill in order to make ends meet. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a new motorcycle so that he can pursue his chosen business appropriately and support his family so that they will have a brighter future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, monsieur Folly H. est né le 17 Avril 1967. Il habite le quartier Djidjolé à Lomé avec sa femme, une ménagère. Il est conducteur de taxi moto. Actuellement sa moto est en panne et ne fonctionne plus mais il n’a pas aussi les moyens d’acheter une autre. Devant cette situation il est obliger d’aller aider un ami qui dispose d’un moulin afin de joindre les deux bouts. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000, pour l’achat d’une moto neuve afin de pouvoir exercer convenablement son activité et faire face aux charges du ménage pour un développement meilleur.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou V. S., age 37, works as a housewife. She helps her husband, who works as a farmer growing rice, by grinding rice and raising pigs, making on average around $3 each day of income. They have eight children, four who are employed by a garment factory making around $2/day each, and four who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more pigs to expand her livestock and buy more seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and buy more seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara Francisca E. V. belongs to the Group "The Roses of Yungay". Her business is the sale of clothing for ladies and gentlemen. Two years ago she offered her products in a tricycle, and now has a small store located in the market of the district and province of Yungay.

With her previous loan for S/. 300, she purchased more merchandise with which she increased her sales. With this loan for S/. 500 which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of clothing for boys and girls.

She is 57 years old and married. Her 6 children already moved out so she works to help support her grandchildren and pay for the house expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Clara Francisca E. V. , ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Rosas de Yungay”, su negocio es la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, hace dos años ofrecía sus productos en un triciclo, actualmente cuenta con un local que esta ubicado en el Campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay. Con el préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro mercaderías con las cuales pudo incrementa ventas Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la comprara de ropa para niños y niñas. Ella tiene 57 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos que están fuera de familia, trabaja para apoyar a sus nietos y sostener los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan, she'll purchase clothing for boys and girls / Con el prestamo comprara ropa de niño y niñas

loans.name: Taga 3 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these five women of Taga 3 on the island of Savaii, passed their written test on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

Penquin Elisapeta M., 37 years old, is married, with no children. She has over two years of experience growing taro on her plantation and selling it at the flea market once a week. She comes from a long line of farmers. She will use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a license, cabbages and tomatoes.

Kaisarina A., 49, is married, with eight children. She is involved in both farming and pancake making. Her main farming produce is taro, a staple of the Samoan diet. With her loan, she will purchase a license to sell, flour, sugar, oil and yeast for the pancakes and pesticide for the taro plantation.

Iokapeta F., 37, is married, with four children. Her brother bakes an assortment of goods including donuts, pies and pork cakes. Iokapeta sells them five days a week to school children and to people in her village. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, sugar, soda powder, oil and mutton flaps (lamb ribs).

Falanika S., 39, is divorced, with two children. She is starting a new business where she will sell cabbages and tomatoes for three days a week. Her loan will be used to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a rake, and a spade and cabbage seeds.

Lole F., 51, is married, with seven children. She is starting a new business where she will sell pork cakes and pork buns for six days a week. Her loan will allow her to purchase flour, yeast, oil, sugar, mutton flaps and a pot.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and ingredients

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa is a very hard-working person and this diligence and effort was a very important legacy that her parents left her so that she would continue getting ahead now that she is part of the support for her own home. She works doing agricultural tasks but her efforts have been more concentrated in breeding animals, specifically cows and bulls that she is now selling after a period of feeding them. She gets up very early in the morning to take them to distant grazing fields and later returns as the day is ending, but always with satisfaction in her heart. She would like to improve her livestock and augment her production, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Justa es una persona muy trabajadora, ese empeño y esfuerzo fue un legado muy importante que le dejaron sus padres para que continúe adelante ahora que ella es parte del sostén D. su propio hogar.Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas pero sus esfuerzos se han centrado mas en la crianza D. animales, específicamente D. vacas y toros que ahora comercializa después D. un tiempo D. engordarlos, ella se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para llevarlos a lejanos pastizales y luego regresa cuando el día está acabando pero con la satisfacción en su corazón, desea mejorar su ganado y aumentar su producción por la cual solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase of capital to improve her livestock and increase the vegetable production in her crop fields

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 43-years old and a divorced mother with three children. She has been selling used cloths for the past eight years in her town market. Charlotte will use her loan to increase her inventory and sales. This loan will help her to start saving money so she can rent a store from which to sell her goods. She is a member of the group called “Bo Bra Pa” meaning Live a Good life. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of  cloths

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Mr. Abdoulaye S. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and only child in an extended family household in the Médine district of Ségou, Republic of Mali.

After the death of his mother, Abdoulaye, the eldest of her children, quickly abandoned his studies after the basic level to become an apprentice tailor with the aim of helping his younger siblings.

After 13 years of experience, he has become a master tailor known throughout Ségou with a clientele composed of different socio-professional groups in the area.

In order to meet the increasing and pressing demands of his customers, he decided to take part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan, and whom he learned about through friends.

He intends to use this loan to buy a sewing machine of the brand CORNA in Ségou.

With this new loan, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA, which will allow him to pay off the interest on his loan and sell sewing materials..

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Abdoulaye S. est âgé 32 ans, il vit avec son épouse et son unique enfant dans une famille élargie au quartier Médine de Ségou République du Mali.

Après le décès de sa mère, Abdoulaye ; l’aîné de cette dernière a très vite abandonné l’école depuis l’enseignement fondamental pour faire l’apprenti tailleur dans le dessein de venir en aide à ses cadets.

Après 13 ans d’expériences, il devient un maître tailleur connu de tout Ségou avec une clientèle composée de différentes catégories socio professionnelle de la place.

Afin de faire face aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est a son 1er prêt individuel ;et qu’il a connu à travers de ses amis.

Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une machine à coudre de marque CORNA à Ségou.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 50 000 CFA qui lui permettra de payer les intérêts du prêt et de faire du commerce de matériels de couture.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mwadawa's Group

texts.en:
Mwadawa has owned a firewood business in Zanzibar since 2005. She works every day from 7:00am to 8:00pm and makes a monthly profit of about $40. She would like to take out a loan in order to expand her business and increase her profit.

Amina is married with three children. Her children are ages 7, 5, and one and a half.

She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to increase her business.

loans.name: Kenneth Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Kenneth E. is 29 years old and married with 3 children.  His oldest son is 10 years old and is in 5th grade, his next oldest is 3 years old and is not yet school-aged, and his youngest is 10 months old.  Kenneth is a clothing and shoe salesman, which he began together with his wife, who delivers the products to the clients.  Kenneth has been in this line of work for 9 years, which has been an alternative to a traditional job because the hours are not fixed.  His dream is for his children to have professional success, as well as to improve his house and live with dignity.  Kenneth hopes to count on your support to begin a small shop which his wife can run while he is working as a traveling salesman. 

 Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor kenneth E., tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, padre de tres hijos, su hijo mayor tiene 10 años cursa el quinto grado de primaria, su otra hija tiene tres años de edad no asiste a clases y su ultimo hijo tiene 10 meses de nacido, la actividad economica del señor es la comercializacion de mercaderia variada como ropa y calzado en general, actividad que desarrolla en conjunto con su esposa quien se encarga de la entrega del producto al cliente, el señor tiene nueve años de tener dicha actividad la cual da inicio como una alternativa de trabajo ya que no tiene trabajo fijo, sus sueño es poder ver realizados a sus hijos profesionalemnte, su mayor deseo es poder mejorar su casa y vivir dignamente, esperando contar con el apoyo nuestro para poder salir adelante con su familia, y mas adelante poder instalar una pequeña tienda para que su esposa la administre mientras el comercializa de forma ambulante.

loans.use: Begin a small shop

loans.name: Yessica Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesica esta casada con Marco Antonio, el trabaja como empleado, tiene un hijo, el negocio empezó una vez que su esposo estaba desempleado, por lo que tenia fuertes necesidades económicas y entonces fue cuando ella busco una fuente de ingresos, y empezó con la venta de lácteos en su casa vendiendo entre sus familiares y después a conocidos y vecinos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Yesica is married to Marco Antonio, who works as a clerk, and she also has a son. Her business started at a time during which her husband was unemployed, and they were in great financial need. Due to their situation, Yesica went in search of a source of income and started a dairy business in her house. She started out selling to other family members and eventually to neighbors and acquaintances. She needs a $300 (U.S.) loan that she will pay back in 6 months in order to purchase merchandise. With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is married and has three children who are three, ten, and eleven years old. She has had a small shop selling clothing and perfumes in Zanzibar for four years. She is currently able to earn approximately $10 each month.

Subira is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may use the capital to expand her business and increase her profit. She will use this loan to buy more clothing and perfumes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and perfumes for her shop.

loans.name: Sadeta

texts.en:
Sadeta was born in 1951 and she lives in Klokotnica, a village in Bosnia.  She lives with her husband and with their two adult sons, both of whom are employed.  She is a housewife, but she also grows vegetables in a garden and takes care of two cows, whose milk she sells in the market.  

She is requesting a loan of 600KM ($400 USD) from Women for Women International to purchase food for her two cows.  She hopes that she will be able to continue raising cows for a long time because “this work makes her happy.”

This loan is guaranteed by Subhija D..

loans.use: To purchase food for cows

loans.name: Neema M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Neema M. from Mbarali. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 17. She is also responsible for supporting two other dependants, because one is orphan and the other has parents, but they cannot take care for him. 

Neema buys crops from farmers and brings them at town where she can sell them at higher price. Neema  has been running her crop business since 2007. 

She works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of $650 USD to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding to the quantity and range of the stock . Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Kokou Olivier

texts.fr: Né en 1967, Mr A. Kokou Olivier est marié et père d’un enfant. Couturier de formation, il assure son métier avec beaucoup de plaisir et de bonne volonté. Ce qui lui confère une grande admiration dans son milieu. En vue de réaménager son atelier et acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre et d’autres matériels de travail, il sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront de mieux s’épanouir et prendre régulièrement soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Olivier A. is married and the father of one child. A tailor by training, he practices his trade with a lot of joy and goodwill. He is greatly admired among his peers. In order to renovate his workshop,and to buy new sewing machines and other work tools, he is requesting a loan. The profit gained from this activity will allow him to be fulfilled and to take care of his family consistently.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de machines à coudre et de matériels de travail

loans.name: Badam Gul Group

texts.en:
Zayajan is the group leader of the Badam Gul group, which has three members. The group's members are each seeking to receive funding for their own businesses in order to better support their families and to solve some of their financial problems.

Specifically, Badam Gul and Zayajan are seeking a loan for their respective carpet-weaving businesses because they want to expand and improve such businesses. Meanwhile, Anesa is requesting a loan for the benefit of her brother’s business. They explain that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs like themselves to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and to better support their families

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 44 years old and married with 4 children. He rears and sells fish and pigs in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. The demand for his pigs and fish is high and he hopes to meet the demand of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to build more pens for the pigs. He is indeed grateful to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To build more pens for the pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia I. U., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 25 años de edad, sin hijos, posee estudios de superior completa (enfermería técnica). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1.5 años, su negocio es la comercialización de golosinas, para lo cual inició con un préstamo de S/. 500 nuevos soles, en la compra de capital de trabajo. 
En el momento refiere tener la intención de ampliar su negocio, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo mas mercadería (galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, etc), con ello generará mayores ingresos y ampliará su mercado, finalmente esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Alicia I. U. belongs to the “El Comercio” Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito province, in the state of Puno. She is 25 years old, has no children, and has completed her studies as a nursing technician.

Alicia has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last year and a half. She has a business selling sweets. She began her business with a working capital loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $163). She is currently seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (US $650) to expand her business. She plans to purchase more merchandise (cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc.), and will thus be able to increase her income and expand her shop.

Finally, Alicia is prepared to repay her loan on time, according to the expectations of her group.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to purchase more merchandise (cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.en:
M. Gairatjon has a responsibility that makes him work hard for improvement. He is a farmer. He grows onions and potatoes, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and providing what is necessary for his family that needs it.

For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Gairatjon knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Gairatjon makes is to purchase fertilizer necessary for his land. Support this hard-working man so his effort is worthwhile.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: El Amor Florece Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Lilliam del Socorro C., Celia María B. y Aura Lila G. M..

 Este grupo solidario es originario de la comarca Las Flores, del municipio de Masaya, los tres se dedican a la misma actividad de venta de frutas y verduras, venden en el mercado municipal de Masaya, ellas tienen muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, llevan varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han demostrado ser personas responsables y puntuales, están comprometidas para quedar bien en la institución.
 
Doña Celia María es una joven mujer que es madre de dos hijos pequeños, vende y compra las frutas en el mercado en horas muy tempranas de la mañana, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre que hasta el día de hoy realiza la misma actividad, está satisfecha de  haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza. Sueña con poder dar estudio a sus hijos y un mejor nivel de vida.

Doña Aura Lila G., es una mujer trabajadora desde muy joven, es madre de un niño pequeño al que mantiene sola, ella es madre soltera y esto le ha dado mayor fuerza para trabajar y poder sacar adelante a su hijo, este estudia en la escuela de la comarca, piensa que la secundaria la pueda cursar en Masaya.

Doña Lilliam del Socorro C. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es muy responsable y el grupo le ha dado el cargo porque sabe leer más que las otras dos integrantes y puede firmar bien. Trabaja en el mercado desde muy joven junto con su mamá, vende frutas y verduras, ahora con el crédito ella ha invertido su propio dinero y tiene su propio puesto, donde ofrece naranjas, limones, tamarindo, cebollas, ajos, etc. Compra los productos en el mercado y en la zona donde vive.
Tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar, con tres adolescentes y un pequeño, estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y uno estudia en Masaya, esto porque ella considera que debe de salir de la comarca y estudiar además otros cursos.
Su horario de trabajo es de las 3 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., cuando regresa a su casa lleva las provisiones para la comida, expresa que el crédito le permite comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y tener mayor margen de ganancia.
Ella anima a sus compañeras a quedar bien para que le sigan financiando y así seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Lilliam del Socorro C., Celia María B., and Aura Lila G. M.. This group is from the Las Flores region in the Masaya municipality. The three members are involved in the same business activity: fruit and vegetable sales. They sell their produce at the Masaya municipal market. They have been in this business for many years, and they have been working with Adim for several loan cycles, demonstrating that they are punctual and responsible people. They are committed to be in good standing with the institute. Ms. Celia María is a young mother of two young children. She buys and sells fruit at the market very early in the morning. She learned this skill from her mother, who is in the same line of work even today. She is pleased to have obtained loans based on trust. She dreams of being able to give her children an education and a better quality of life. Ms. Aura Lila G. has been a hard-worker since she was young. She is raising her young son on her own. As a single mother, she has become strong enough to work and help her son get ahead in life. He is a student at the local school, and she thinks that he will be able to attend secondary school in Masaya. Ms. Lilliam del Socorro C. is the group coordinator. She was given this post because she can read more then the other members, and can sign her name well. She has been working at the market from a young age alongside her mother. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has invested this loan, she has been able to invest her own money and now has her own stand in which she sells oranges, lemons, tamarind, onions, garlic, etc. She purchase these products at the market, then sells them in her area of residence. She has four school age children—three adolescents and one child—who study at their local school. One of her children studies in Masaya because she feels that he should leave the region and take extra courses. Her work schedule begins at 3 a.m. and ends at 2 p.m. When she returns home, she takes groceries. She states that the loan allows her to purchase a greater amount of fruit, which yields her greater profits. She motivates her colleagues to be in good stand and keep borrowing so that they can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tuwe Wakweli Group

texts.en:
Zuhura has been selling clothes, in addition to cooking and selling food, in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $230. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and food items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.  

Zuhura is 32 years old, married, and cares for two dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Samira, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla D. is from the city of Dapitan City. She is 40 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Luzvilla owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Luzvilla has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Luzvilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of raw materials to transform into cereal products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old local restaurant operator and currently lives with her family. She is married and has seven children. Two of her children are in school, while the rest are learning trades. She has been in food provision for over six years now. She understands customer ethics and is also aware that customers mean cash; for that reason, she does not down play on quality and excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves; therefore, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in the food delivery service.

She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.fr: Bibi Boyelipo est micro-entrepreneur depuis 1992. Elle a commencé à vendre les arachides, les gâteaux et les maniocs grillés avec un capital initial de $10. Son activité a prospéré grâce aux bénéfices accumulés réinvestis, la bonne gestion ainsi que son courage très remarquable. Bibi est parvenue à maintenir sa clientèle pendant plus d’une décennie dans son quartier situé à l’est de Kinshasa. En 2008, elle décide d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC dénommé « Manasé Plus » en vue d’avoir un appui financier permanent qui va l’aider à concrétiser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une chambre froide ou un magasin des pièces électriques. Elle a déjà reçu quatre fois les prêts de Hope qu’elle a remboursé correctement. Le prochain crédit lui servira d’acheter une machine à moudre les arachides en pate dans le but de diversifier son affaire qui lui génère actuellement un bénéfice de $20 par semaine. Bibi a 52 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgés de 15 et 16 ans. Tous deux sont élèves à l’école secondaire. En dehors de ces deux enfants, elle prend aussi soins de deux autres enfants orphelins. Il s’agit d’un neveu et une nièce.
texts.en:
Bibi Boyelipo has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1992. She began to sell peanuts, cookies, and grilled manioc with a initial capital of US $10. Her business prospered thanks to reinvested income, good management, and her remarkable courage.

Bibi managed to maintain her clientele for more than a decade in her neighborhood located in the east of Kinshasa. In 2008, she decided to join one of the groups of IMF HOPE RDC, a group called « Manasé Plus » in order to get an ongoing series of loans which will allow her to make her dream come true--to one day open a "cold store" or an electrical parts store.

She has already received 4 loans from HOPE that she has reimbursed correctly. The next loan will allow her to buy a mill to make the peanuts into peanut butter with the intention of diversifying her business which is generating presently a profit of US$ 20 per week.

Bibi is 52, married and the mother of 2 children, 15 and 16. Both are enrolled in secondary school. Besides these two children, she also takes care of two other children who are orphans--a nephew and a niece of hers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a mill to grind peanuts into peanut butter for resale

loans.name: Bishara

texts.en:
Bishara is a member of the Mungu Muweza borrower group. She is a 63-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of two children aged 36 and 34 years.

Two years ago, Bishara started her own café business selling food. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 40,000 Tsh.

This is Bishara`s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her café. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Bishara hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her café

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Florence supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a unique entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She is in her sixties and she has had a hard life, but that doesn’t prevent her from leading an active and determined lifestyle. Mariya has raised two daughters who love and admire their mom. They were totally supportive of their mom when she decided to launch her small venture selling shirts, blouses, sweaters, and dresses about 10 years ago. Mariya has now earned about 6,000 Grivnyas (more than $700 USD) in profit.  

Mariya is seeking a 7,000 Grivnya loan to increase and diversify her inventory and increase her turnover capital as a result. She is highly respected by both her customers and fellow businessmen because she is a person of integrity and perseverance, and she always remains that way even in the midst of most challenging circumstances.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita E. started her business in rice farming and hog raising way back 1965.  Today she is already 63 years old who lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with 9 children.  She owns 1-hectare rice field manage by her son with an average harvest of 85 to 100 sacks.

She would like to ask for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. worth Php 12,000.  She will use the loan to buy materials for the farm and payment for land preparation.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Fanni Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Fanni Rosa; es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y ella pertenece al banco comunal, Chaska ñahui, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el arte, ella es cantante de profesión y trabaja en la peña la rústica, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para cubrir algunos inconvenientes que tiene.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y de este modo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el banco comunal y pagar sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fanni Rosa was born in the city of Cusco and is a member of the communal bank Chaska ñahui, located in Cusco. She is 40 years old and a single mother with two children. She divides her time between her household labors and her art: she is a singer by profession and works in a peña (a gathering place offering folk music and traditional food) called La Rústica. She is requesting a loan to cover some of her recent expenses. Fanni appreciates and values the loan offered to her, and she has made a commitment to continue fulfilling the requirements of the communal bank and making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying recent expenses

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío la Huaca, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y media al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietario de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado muy utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) desde hace cinco meses. El brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en Olmos y sus caseríos. Anterioremente se dedicaba al comercio de chatarra, pero no le resultaba rentable, así que con sus ahorros compró el vehículo que actualmente usa para sustentar a su familia.

El contínuo uso de su unidad móvil y lo agreste de las carreteras por donde circula ha ocasionado algunos deperfectos en el motor. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez   a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para hacer las reparaciones necesarias y continuar apoyando a su familia.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una tienda de abarrotes en Olmos para que sea administrada por su madre. El es un joven responsable y que desde hace mucho tiempo vela por el bienestar de su madre.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old and single, and he lives with his mother in the la Huaca hamlet in the Olmos district, which is located an hour and a half to the north of Chiclayo City. He has owned a “mototaxi” (a motorvihicle frequently used for the transport of cargo and passengers) for five months. He offers transportation services to passengers from Olmo and its hamlets. Previously, he sold scrap metal for a living, but it was not profitable, so with his savings he bought this vehicle with which he can now actually provide for his family. The continual use of his vehicle and the rough roads of his circuit have caused some motor damage. For this reason, he is seeking his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 800 new soles in order to make the necessary repairs and continue to provide for his family. His greatest wish is to set up a general store in Olmos for his mother to run. He is a responsible young man and has looked after his mother for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repairing a motor vehicle (mototaxi)

loans.name: Roquina

texts.en:
Roquina T. is from the village of San Roque Barianut, Iligan City. She is 58 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Roquina owns and operates a business selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Roquina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $109 a month from these activities. In 2009, Roquina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Roquina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Roquina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el caserío El Romero, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la confección artesanal de alforjas (accesorio utilizado por los agricultores de la zona para cargar alimentos y utensilios durante las horas de trabajo) y manteles de hilo. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibía como agricultor no bastaban para sostener la economía familiar.

María hace su trabajo en base a pedidos que llegan a hacerle los vecinos de su caserío y de caseríos aledaños. Elaborar una sola alforja le toma cerca de 20 días. Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ella desea ampliarlo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar los materiales que necesita, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hilos, lanas y lanillas para lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir apoyando a la educación de sus hijos y verlos convertidos en excelentes profesionales. María es muy conocida por sus vecinos los que la consideran una mujer responsable, alegre y amable.
texts.en:
María, 38, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the El Romero settlement, Mórrope district, which is 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years she has crafted knapsacks (an accessory used by the local farmers to carry their lunch and eating utensils during their work periods) and woven tablecloths. She tells us that she had to start this line of work because the income her husband earned as a farmer was insufficient to meet the family's basic needs. María works based on orders she gets from her neighbors and from residents of adjacent settlements. To make a single knapsack takes her 20 days. Her business has been growing and she wants to expand it even more but lacks sufficient funds to buy the necessary supplies so she is requesting funds, for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the form of a 1000 new sol loan, which will be used to buy thread, wool and flannel in order to reach her goal. Her greatest wish is to continue to provide for her children's education and see them become excellent professionals. María is very well-known by her neighbors who consider her to be a responsible, cheerful, and kind woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and flannel to make knapsacks.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel F. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 61 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos mayores por quienes se esfuerza dìa a dìa.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace nueve años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra de víveres para preparar comida y luego venderla
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà vìveres para seguir vendiendo comidas y además comprara gaseosas. 
La meta de Isabel es aumentar sus ventas implementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel F. is a hardworking and active communal bank member who lives in the City of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali Region. She is 61 years old, and a single mother with 7 older children that are the reason she works hard day to day. Isabel sells food and beverages from home. She has been part of the “Las Nazarenas” Communal Bank for the past nine years; the first loan that she received was of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase supplies to prepare and sell food. Currently she needs a loan of 1,800 PEN with which she will purchase supplies to continue preparing and selling food, as well as soft drinks. Isabel’s goals are to increase her sales, and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase supplies to be able to continue selling food, as well as to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda, de 20 años, es una joven madre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
En la mina La Rinconada tiene un pequeño puesto de tejidos artesanales, ella lleva hasta esta zona minera las prendas que ha tejido en el taller que tiene en su habitación, de igual manera también lleva prendas que compra a otras tejedoras, lo cual hace que su negocio tenga una mayor variedad de tejidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la mina, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la zona.
Con el tiempo, espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Hermelinda con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 20 years old. She is a young mother who lives at home with her parents and wants very much to succeed in life. In the mining town of La Rinconada, she has small vending post where she sells handmade fabrics. She also has a workshop in her home where she produces woven garments. Hermelinda spends as much time buying clothes made by other people as she does producing her own. Therefore, she is able to stock her business with a wider variety of items.

What she enjoys most about her work is being able to chat with her neighbors while making sales. This enables her to keep up with events that are happening around the mines. Hermelinda has been in this business for two years and she thinks the hardest part is dealing with the extremely cold weather in the area. Over time, she hopes to open a store where she can serve her customers with greater convenience.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Hermelinda has been very punctual with her previous loans and she is expected to do the same with this one. She is very active in her Communal Bank and admired by the rest of the members. With her loan of 500 soles, she will buy more wool for producing new handmade garments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de agua en sachet y a la venta de plátanos, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a lo mismo. Yolanda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Ucayali”.
Con este crédito de 200 soles comprará plátanos al por mayor. El anhelo de Yolanda es comprarse una máquina de coser y poner un taller de costura ya que le gusta esta actividad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a new member who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 29 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She sells sachet water and bananas out of her home. She has the support of her husband who also helps with the business. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Ucayali” (The Breezes of Ucayali).

With this loan of 200 soles, she will buy bananas in bulk. Yolanda dreams of obtaining a sewing machine so that she can open her own sewing workshop since she enjoys this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Cristo Viene 3&4 Group

texts.en:
Rosaline is the coordinator of her group, CriS. Viene (ChriS.is Coming), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, an area known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband and their child.

Rosaline is excited to be taking her firS.loan with Esperanza, a Kiva partner. She plans to use this loan to inveS.in her business of selling used clothing by purchasing assorted used clothing that comes in bulk packages from places like the Salvation Army in the United States. She will use the profits to inveS.in her family in the short term by purchasing clothing and food for her child. Her long-term dream is to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Packages of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Nelly Antonia

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Nelly es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Nelly es accionista de una empresa que presta servicios de mantenimiento, limpieza, a diferentes instituciones, Nelly es la gerente de la empresa.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de limpieza.
Los sueños de Nelly son ampliar su empresa a nivel nacional y tener otra empresa de otro giro
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Nelly is a co-owner of a business that provides maintenance and cleaning services to different institutions. She is also the manager of the company.

Nelly needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cleaning products. Her dreams are to expand her business nationally and start another business in a different industry.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Savinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Savinh D. (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Boeun Chea, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have been married for over thirty years. They have six children, two daughters and four sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, one is a soldier, another is a construction worker and the youngest one is in school. 

Savinh has been a silk weaver since she was 27 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.  She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 28-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. His wife owns a drug shop and they live together with their one year old child. Together with his wife, they both contribute to the family welfare.

Geoffrey started working in a bakery then rode his sister-in-law’s motorcycle for hire, after which he used his small savings and a loan from HOFOKAM to buy his own motorcycle.

Geoffrey’s business plan for the loan is to buy a new motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthry Soy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 people who are all villagers in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chanthry S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Chanthry S. is an animal food seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Kim K., is a traditional medicine seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Chanthry S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food for resale. She is a mother of five children, one of whom helps her to sell animal food, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more pig food for resale

loans.name: Kirmany Ole

texts.en:
Kirmany Ole N. is 48 years old, married to Nasarusaru N. and a father of four school-going children. Kirmany is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for fifteen years.

He learned about KADET from other members within his locality who had already registered as members in Kadet. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to plant more wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kirmany's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat planting

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is 41 years old, married, and has five children. For the past 10 years, her family has lived in a small house of two rooms.
 
She is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t want that also to be her chidlren's destiny. By the blessing of God three of her children (two daughters and one son) are enrolled in a school and are reading in 6th, 5th and 4th standards. Her first two sons work in a local factory and earn monthly wages.
 
She is a very hardworking lady. Although she is not educated, she learned sewing skills from her mother. She began to benefit from these skills after her marriage. Now she is an expert at sewing and can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. She earns approximatley PKR 5000 every month, which she saves for the future of her children. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor and has been in this business for over 10 years. He sells fruit by going to different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He hopes to have his own fruit shop in the main market where people can come to buy fruit. 
 
Sugran has successfully repaid five loans to Asasah (microfinance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). Now she is applying for a loan for the sixth time to purchase seasonal fruit in bulk so her husband may expand his fruit-selling business and generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruit in bulk to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
51 year-old Gloria M. is married to Joel, who is 40 years-old.  They live in Brgy. San Isidro, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store business.

Gloria joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 21,000 from her business activities.

Gloria is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 18th cycle loan in the amount of Php 25,000 which she intends to use for her general store. Gloria is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es:
Sulpicia es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con una hija y sus nietos, Sulpicia se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica llamada 5 esquinas y vende todos los días por las noches y los domingos vende comida en la feria de ganados de la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo y esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carne, pescado, pollo, papa y gas.
Sulpicia menciona que en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y su mayor sueño son comprar una camioneta para llevar su negocio y terminar de construir su tercer piso.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is married, has 3 children, and lives with one of her daughters and her grandchildren. She makes a living by selling kebabs, traveling along a central street called 5 Corners. She sells them every night, and on Sundays she sells food at the city's livestock fair, with the help of her son and husband. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of beef, fish, chicken, potatoes, and gas. Sulpicia mentions that through Finca she learned to save money, and her greatest dream is to purchase a truck for her business and to finish construction on the third floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef, fish, chicken, potatoes, and gas

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach L., age 46, lives in Prambei Mom village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ron Prak, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mrs. Thach L. is also a Khmer noodle vendor, which allows her to earn a small additional income to help support her family. 

In order to make it easier for her to transport Khmer noodles door-to-door, Mrs. Thach L. has decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for transport. 

This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the younger three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Serious Traders Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Serious Traders” group. They are businesspeople with small-scale businesses based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata T. (pictured on the right). She is age twenty-seven and was born in Makeni where she is currently residing with her husband and one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is attending primary school.

For four years now, Fatmata has been selling slippers/flip-flops. With her share of the loan, she will buy dozens of pairs of slippers to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy dozens of pairs of slippers to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene D. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 31 years old and is married but has no children. Arlene owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la comunidad D. Cajamarca del distrito D. Cachimayo y tiene 40 años. Actualmente, Juana vive en la ciudad D. misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La ciudad D. Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Juana se dedica a la venta D. chicha y también tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, donD. la pueden encontrar los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 5 D. mañana hasta las 8 D. la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro D. pan. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Juana que espera recibir S/. 100o nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. 

El banco comunal “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio D. funcionamiento, Juana pertenece desD. hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios D. este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the community of Cajamarca in the Cachimayo district. She is 40 years old. Now Juana lives in the same city with her husband and their 3 children. The city of Cachimayo is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Juana sells chicha (a traditional Peruvian corn-based beverage) and also has a grocery store, where you can find her 7 days a week from 5am until 8 at night, or until she runs out of her supply of bread. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive 1,000 Peruvian soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy food such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. The communal bank “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been in operation for 3 and a half years. Juana has belonged to the group for 3 years, and it is going very well. The members from this place are devotees of Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they used this name for their communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food such as: rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina N. lives in Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with four children who all attend school.  Zaina has been in business selling banana leaves for over 10 years, and she works 7 days every week. Zaina sells her products in Kalerwe market and sells both on a wholesale and retail basis.

Zaina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of banana leaves. The main business challenges for Zaina are  transportation and seasonality.  Her aspirations for her business are to deal in both bananas and banana leaves and to sell wholesale only. Zaina lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are utility bills, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of banana leaves.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen K. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).  Maureen has a business selling African attire (bitenge). She has been doing this for a long time and works 6 days out of every week. Maureen sells her products door-to-door and at retail only. Maureen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of African attire. She also generates additional income through selling locally made ghee (clarified butter). The main business challenge for Maureen includes seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are constructing her own house and getting a permanent business premise.   Maureen lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing (African attire)

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.en:
A. Jumakhon is 22 years old, married, and has a little child. For more than three years Jumakhon has raised young cattle and has sold them at the market in order to support his family. Since his business is going well, he wishes to expand it. Jumakhon has decided to ask for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy more young cattle for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan. This purchase will enable Jumakhon to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his dear child for whose sake he is working hard. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda U. is 45 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the barangay of Villaros within the municipality of Bagabag, a part of Nueva Vizcaya province in the Luzon islands. Rosalinda runs a motorcycle transport business. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 9000 PHP that will be used to repair her vehicle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle that she uses in her business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Рахимова Гулноза проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 20 лет. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает детские костюмчики. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Gulnoza R. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 20 years old, single.  She has a secodary education and works at a market.  Gulnoza leases a retail outlet, where she sells children's clothing.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand the merchandise assortment.

loans.use: Expanding assortment

loans.name: Francisca Ynes

texts.en:
Francisca is 40 years old. She lives near the coastal town of Pimentel which lies twenty minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo. It is a desert region primarily populated by fisherman, artisans and small animal raisers. She shares her home with her partner and her two young children.

Francisca works as a teacher in a local school, primarily teaching reading and writing. She enjoys sharing her knowledge and bettering the education system in her area. At home she raises cuyes (guinea pigs) and other small animals. These function as an additional income source, a source of food and a savings vehicle. She sells the animals in local markets. Her husband is a public transit driver.

This will be Francisca's first loan with Edpyme Alterntiva. She has requested the funds in order to make some general improvements to her home and to purchase additional balanced feed for her animals. She wants to be able to take advantage of current prices and create a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to make general improvements to her home and to purchase additional balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 62 years old and married. To make a living, Lerma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lerma also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells coffee, sugar and other products.

Lerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lerma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Thelma Claribel

texts.es: Thelma Claribel A. Vda. D. A. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Quezaltepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es una persona muy responsable la cual debe trabajar muy duro por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos D. 13 y 4 años D. edad, quienes dependen por completo D. ella. Thelma posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo D. negocios.
