Thelma cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que a pesar D. estar sola y velar por el bienestar D. su hogar ha sabido dar lo mejor D. si, Thelma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Thelma Claribel Aguila is 39 years old and a widow.  She lives in Quezaltepeque, in San Salvador department.  She is a very responsible person who must work very hard to get her two children, aged 13 and 4, ahead in life as they depend completely on her.

Thelma owns a store in which she sells essential household products and toiletries such as soap, shampoo, bread, milk, candy and other products which are the basic staples of this type of business.  Thelma has very good references from her neighbors and friends since although she is alone and looks out for the well-being of her household, she has known how to give her the very best of herself.

Thelma is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business with everything she needs to increase her inventory.  This way she will be able to offer her customers more products and improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks and bread to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz zona 3 de Mayo. El es chofer socio propietario del trufi 88. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene un hijo. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de motor y realizara la transformación a G.N.V. (gas Natural vehicular) para reducir el costo de gasolina, pues el GNV es mucho más barato. Esto le permitirá mejorar su  ingreso mensual.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro; el estudio de ingresos y gastos indica que Tomas está en condiciones asumir un préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his parents' home which is located in "3 de Mayo" neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  He is a driver who owns his own public transport vehicle and works on a fixed route (88).  This is his main source of income with which he supports himself.  He has one son.

Tomas will use this loan to buy a new engine and convert his vehicle into an NGV (Natural Gas Vehicle) to reduce his fuel costs since natural gas is much cheaper.  This will allow him to improve his monthly income.

This is Tomas' first loan with Impro.  Our study of his income and expenses would indicate that he is approved to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his public transport vehicle and convert it to run on natural gas

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is 34 years old, married and has eight children who are between seven months and fifteen years old. Currently, six of her children attend school.  Rosette sells clothes, which she has done for seven years. Her husband is a carpenter.  Rosette will use the loan to purchase more clothes to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Rosette plans to refurbish her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel; el tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja en una chicharroneria hace una par de años atrás el cual le gusta mucho y  le brinda varias satisfacciones y alegrías pero ahora el socio desea independizarse abriendo su propio negocio de venta de chicharrones( plato a base de chancho) y de esta manera el poder crecer más como negociante y poder trabajar para el mismo y así poder tener un poco mas de ingresos para su familia el socio es una persona bien alegre y de esta forma el saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio venta de chicharrones como mesas, sillas, e insumos para la preparación de los chicharrones.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miguel belongs to the “Ahorro Es Progresso – Saylla” (Saving is Progress - Saylla) Communal Bank.  The bank is locted in the Saylla district, which is in the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Miguel, age 26, is in a common-law-marriage and has one child.  He has worked in a “chicharroneria” (restaurant that serves pork) for a couple of years.  He likes it a lot, and it gives him much satisfaction and joy.  But, he now wants to become independent by opening his own business selling chicarrones (a pork based dish). 

This way he will be able to grow more as a business man, and he will be able to work for himself.  That way he will have a little more income for his family.  He is a very happy person, and that is how he gets his family ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy things for his new business of selling chicharrones.  He will buy things like tables and chairs.  He will also buy supplies for making the chicharrones.

He is very happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loans.use: To set up his own business selling chicharrones.  He will get things like tables, chairs and supplies to make the chicharrones

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is a 53-year-old widowed mother of four children who lives in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her older daughter studies in Germany, while a younger son and two daughters study at a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Although she officially retired in 2009, she kept her current job as a cook in a school dormitory to help support her family. In 2010 she bought a public condominium located near her work. Her two daughters who study in Ulaanbaatar have part time jobs in order to support their daily needs. 

Dulamsuren began a baked goods business in addition to her job, since she has to support and pay for her four children's education. She supplies baked goods for lunch to local school children, which is paid for by the government. She also purchases old towels that are used to clean the school dormitory from a wholesale market, and supplies them to the dormitory at a higher price. 

She says, "Paying the tuition fees and providing a living for four children is not easy. Therefore, I do several things in addition to my job, as I have to make more money until my children finish their studies. Two of my daughters will graduate from University next year."

Dulamsuren is a hardworking person. She is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase the ingredients for her baked goods.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her baked goods

loans.name: Enhchimeg

texts.en:
Enhchimeg, 29, is married and lives with her husband in the Hentii province of Mongolia. They live in a house that they own and have a decent standard of living. Her husband owns and operates a taxi, transporting people between cities and traveling seven or eight times a month. 

Enhchimeg began selling clothes in 2008. She operates a rented stall at a local trading center. Her monthly income is between 1,500,000 and 1,800,000 MNT. The trading center where she operates her stall is located on a busy street which is an advantage for her business. Enhchimeg is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business. She is a modest and hardworking regular customer of our bank who says, "I would like to carry on this business and expand it since I support my family with the income from this business. I want to increase the amount and variety of goods that I sell."

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia C. is from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Adelia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Adelia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling health & medicinal products such as generic drugs in the local community. Adelia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Adelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as generic drugs. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Adelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional generic drugs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, tiene 35 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su madre, un tío, y los hijos D. ella, quienes tienen 5 y 7 años D. edad, es empleada D. una comercial como encargada D. la administración, lleva 12 años D. laborar en este mismo lugar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. un lote, ya que se le presenta la oportunidad D. comprar el terreno, su dificultad es no contar con el fondo total para adquirirlo, este préstamo será su gran apoyo para realizar los trámites, aumentado así el patrimonio.
En este terreno ella tiene como meta construir la casa, para llevarse ahí a sus hijos, viviendo en lo propio y más cómodos.
texts.en:
Dora, 35, lives with her mother, an uncle and her children who are 5 and 7 years of age.  She’s employed by a firm in the Administration department; she’s been working at the same place for 12 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy a lot because the opportunity to buy it has presented itself and her difficulty is not having the entire amount needed available.  This loan, then, will be a great help to carry out all the procedures to increase her estate.  Her goal is to build a house on this lot to go live there with her children to be more comfortable living in a place of their own.

loans.use: to buy a piece of property.

loans.name: Munhtsog

texts.en:
Munhtsog, 38, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent. Her two children both attend local secondary school. 

She operates a good trading business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2007 out of a stall in a local market. Since then she managed to expand her business and built a good relationship both with her partners and with her customers. Now her working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. 

She is a hardworking lady who possesses good communication skills. She says, "All I want is bright future for my children. For that reason, I am doing my best in order to provide good education for my children." She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase socks, lingerie and kid toys for her business.

loans.use: to purchase socks, lingerie and kid toys

loans.name: Chhay's Group

texts.en:
Consisting of 11 people, this village bank loan is led by Mrs. Chhay, the village bank president selected by the others members, each of whom will use their portion to support their specific purpose.

Chlyi and her husband are grocery sellers  able to earn a small income to support their famiL. living. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Chhay is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factories and one is a grocery seller.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
La señora Yessenia Lidieth C. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 28 años quien hace seis años con un préstamo inicio su negocio de venta de comida actividad en la que invertirá el crédito. 
El crédito que está solicitando es de temporada para aprovechar que viene el día de las madres y tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Yessenia Lidieth C. is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman of 28 who started a business selling food with the aid of a loan six years ago.  She will invest this loan in the same business.

The loan that Yessenia is requesting is seasonal, so that she can take advantage of the fact that Mother's Day is approaching and she has orders.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 36, has run a motorcycle transportation business for the past two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.13,500. He and his wife, Mary, have one child. Mary runs a retail shop business and they both help to support the family.

This is Samuel's first loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to service and repair his motorcycles. Samuel intends to use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle and hopes eventually to own a fleet of commercial vehicles in future. His goal is to fund the education of his child.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorcycles

loans.name: Rosa Amira

texts.es:
En la parroquia Rio Chico  del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como San Clemente, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal San Clemente De Rio Chico, este lugar es conocido por su vegetación y porque la mayoría de su gente se dedica al agro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo sola, pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, ahora ella vive sola ya que vivía con su mamá pero ella hace 4 meses también falleció.
 
Tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa en el cual también vende gaseosas y otras bebidas. Nos cuenta que además tiene en sociedad con uno de sus hijos una panadería la cual la administra su hijo y que la tienen en otra ciudad. Ella en su negocio trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 20h00, nos comenta que este negocio le sirvió de mucho una vez que falleció su esposo y que le sirve hasta la actualidad para sus gastos y  de distracción para olvidar tanta soledad.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, manteca, sal, huevos y otros ingredientes para elaborar el pan y carne, salchichas, papas, etc. para su negocio de comidas rápidas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta todo del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In Rio Chico parish, in Portoviejo canton, we find a place called San Clemente.  Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Clemente de Rio Chico' community bank meet here.  This area is known for its vegetation and for the fact that most of the locals work in agriculture.

Here we meet 61 year-old Rosa.  Several years ago, Rosa's beloved husband passed away and she was left on her own.  She has six children from her marriage who are all grown up and live independently.  Now Rosa lives alone.  She used to live with her mom but, four months ago, her mom also passed away.

Rosa has a fast food business in her home where she also sells soda and other drinks.  She tells us that she also owns a bakery in partnership with one of her children.  Her son runs the bakery which is located in another city.  Rosa works in her business every day from 2.00pm to 8.00pm.  She tells us that the business has been a great help to her since her husband died.  It helps her to cover her expenses and also keeps her busy so that she is able to forget the great loneliness that she feels.

Rosa will use this loan to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs and other ingredients for making bread.  She will also buy meat, sausages, potatoes, etc. for her fast food business.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes everything about it.

Rosa's dream is to own a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, salt, eggs, meat, sausages, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Reina De Inglaterra

texts.es: Reina De Inglaterra tiene 54 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 12 años cuando su esposo ya estaba por jubilarse de su empleo, empezó comprando queso al por mayor, luego lo ahumaba y puesto a la venta, luego introdujo crema y cuajadas, con el tiempo también empezó a comprar frijoles y los cocía y luego vendía frijoles cocidos, con los financiamiento obtenido ha comprado y mantenido su clientela ya que estos productos en la actualidad tiene un alto costo. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de cuajada, queso, crema, leche y leche agria.
texts.en: Reina de Inglaterra is 54 years old. She sells milk products. She started this business 12 years ago, when her husband was already retired. She started buying cheese wholesale, smoking it, and putting it up for sale. Later she introduced cream and curds. Over time, she also started buying beans and cooking them, selling baked beans. With other loans she received, she made purchases to maintain her clientele since these products now cost more. She is now requesting this loan to purchase curds, cheese, cream, milk, and sour milk (similar to buttermilk).

loans.use: to purchase curd, cheese, cream, milk, and sour milk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is holding some of the hair scarfs she sells. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a trader. Her business is just a year old and she wants to expand it by adding blouses to it.

The loan, when received, would be used to buy blouses in addition to the scarfs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy blouses in addition to the scarfs to sell

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene tiene 30 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Mercy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte y jugar con el hijo.
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing crops such as corn and rice.

Mercy is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Mercy enjoys taking part in sports and playing with her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old, married and a mother to two infant-age children. Cristina's spouse works as a farmer producing rice for sale and food consumption. 

She has had a  business buying and selling fruits and vegetables for four years now to make a living. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used to purchase various fruits and vegetables to sell. Cristina buys her products in remote villages in their province and bring these to sell in the market.   

In the future, Cristina would like to improve the business she manages in order to earn a higher income to further support the growing needs of her family and eventually save for the future comfort of her family.

loans.use: to purchase various fruits and vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth, a 46-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop selling canned goods, snacks, beverages and noodles for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and breads.  In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & breads.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta frazadas, cubre camas, colchas, pijamas y otras cosas más. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El crédito que requiere Emilia es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cubre camas y frazadas.  

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Emilia was born in the city of Cusco (Perú).  She’s 42 years old.  She currently lives in the city of her birth where she carries out her economic activities.  She has a small business selling blankets, comforters, bedspreads, pajamas and other things.  She’s been in business for six years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  The loan Emilia wants is to buy merchandise like bedspreads and blankets, for example.

The “Virgen de Chapi” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristic and commercial zone, for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like bedspreads and blankets, for example.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 23 años es soltero y tiene una hija de 1 año vive en Ibarra, se describe como un microempresario que quiere salir adelante.

Trabaja solo en su negocio de comidas rápidas, negocio en el cual empezó con dinero que le prestó su mamá. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI el mismo que utilizará para la ampliación de su puesto de comidas rápidas lo cuál incrementaría la afluencia de personas en su negocio que implica más ventas y más ingresos para el. Su sueño es poner una cadena de locales para incrementar sus ventas y poder en un futuro construir una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 23 years old, is single and has a one-year-old daughter.  He lives in Ibarra and describes himself as a small businessman who wants to make progress.

He works by himself in his fast-food business, a business which he started with money that his mother lent him.

This is the first time he has sought a loan from FODEMI, which he will use to expand his fast-food stall, which will increase his customer base, bringing him more sales and greater income. 

His dream is to open a chain of locations to increase his sales and be able to build a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: to expand his fast food stall.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Myagmardorj is 49 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works at the local landscaping office. His daughter is a high school student. He started his business in 2000 by selling wood and coal at the local market. He came from the countryside to the town after selling his livestock and animals. In 2006, he took a loan of 300,000 MNT from XacBank and successfully expanded his business. As of today, he owns a sales booth in which he can sell wood and coal at the local market. He is a diligent man who says, "I want to increase my business and income as well so that I can build a house for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and coal for the winter sales.

loans.use: To purchase wood and coal

loans.name: Tileu

texts.en: Tileu is 37 years old and lives with his wife and child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. He started a family business of selling meat in 2010. Aside from the family business, he has a full-time job. However, his family business is only active in the fall season. He is planning to purchase more animals and to store their meat during this time of year. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my capital turnover." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase livestock from the countryside.

loans.name: C5666 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Consilde, 30 years old, is married and has two children, 2 and 9 years old. She is the president of a group called "Duteraninkunga" in the local language. The group is composed of five women. In the photo, Consilde is the first person on the left.

Consilde has been selling cooking oil, sugar, breads, etc. for three years. Her business is well organized and she works from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. Consilde has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bread, salt, sugar and rice in larger quantities. With the resulting profit, Consilde and her team will be able to save for their future and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, sugar, breads and other items.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygamme avec deux épouses.Il est père de 4 enfants dont 2 sont à l'école.Il  dispose d'un taxi et  exerce l'activité de transport de marchandises pour les commercants.Il assure aussi le service de  déménagement.Avec cette activité, il entretient sa famille et est parvenu à construire une maison dont les travaux sont en phase de finition.C'est à cet effet qu'il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour réaliser un bloc de toillettes externes dans cette maison.Son ambition est d'acheter une nouvelle voiture.
texts.en: The borrower is a polygamist married man with two wives. He is father to four children, two of whom are in school. He practices the activity of transporting merchandise for shopkeepers. He also insures the moving service. With this activity, he takes care of his family and managed to build a house, for which the work is in its final stages. It is for this purpose that he asks for a loan of 500000f to make a block of external bathrooms in his house. His ambition is to buy a new car.

loans.use: to make a block of external bathrooms

loans.name: Kasika Business Group

texts.en: Pauliano is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for six years. He started the business after saving money from distilling local brew. His hardship is inadequate capital, and his vision is to have a stock of six million plus educating his children. Pauliano needs this loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Eom

texts.en: Eom, 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Eom is employed at a garment factory and her husband is motor-taxi driver. The couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Eom is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can operate his business more efficiently. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Mhende Group

texts.en:
Rudo is a 33 year old lady and is married with 4 children aged 11, 7, 4 and one. Two of her children go to school. Her husband is employed as a butcher. They have no other dependents.

Rudo sells hair products from the local market in town. She sells braids, weaves and wigs. She has been in the business for 2 years. Currently she does not have any employees. The challenge she faces in the business is that some of her debtors fail to pay on time. She wishes to open a boutique in town in the next 5 years. The loan will improve life for her family as she will be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids and wigs.

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es:
Actualmente el negocio de la señora Esthela le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de producto y con el préstamo desea aumentar las ventas y ofrecer a sus clientes los productos de lácteos, verduras y carnes frías.
Doña Esthela  es quien atiende personalmente su negocio desde hace un año y su esposo realiza trabajos de herrería y de electricidad con estos ingresos solventan los gastos de su familia ay que tiene dos hijos uno de 10 años y un bebe de tan solo un año. 
Desean darle lo mejor y que tengan una vida sin falta de necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Esthela’s current business needs a greater variety of products and she would like to use the money from this loan to increase her sales and offer milk products, vegetables, and cold meats to her customers.

Esthela has personally been running the business for a year.  Her husband works in metalwork and is an electrician and they cover the family expenses with these incomes.  They have two children, ages ten and one.

They want to provide the best for their children and ensure that they are not in need of anything financially.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es: El señor Lázaro de 32 años es padre y esposo responsable que su mayor prioridad en la vida es tener unida a la familia y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 3 años inicio con el negocio de transporte urbano del cual es su fuente de ingresos, pero hay una cosa que no le deja ganar mas ya que la unidad en la que trabaja se la renta a una persona por lo que le genera mayor gasto. Por eso el quiere comprar un camión que le ofrecen a un buen precio y que está en perfectas condiciones; por lo quiere aprovechar la oferta, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para completar. Por tal motivo Lázaro recurre a solicitar de su apoyo para completar el dinero y comprar el camion de esta manera el obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Lázaro is 32 years old, and is a responsible father and husband.  His biggest priority in life is to be close to his family and to offer them a better quality of life.  He started his urban transport business 3 years ago and it is his source of income.  However, there is one thing preventing him from earning more, and that is the fact that he rents the vehicle he drives from another individual, which creates additional expenses for Lázaro.  He therefore wants to purchase a truck that has been offered to him for a good price and is in perfect condition.  Lázaro wants to take advantage of the offer, but he doesn’t have the capital that he needs to complete the deal.  That is why Lázaro is asking for your support: so that he can raise the money he needs to purchase the truck and thus earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to use for his transport business.

loans.name: Ndhlovu Group

texts.en:
This is Kenneth, a 32-year-old married man from Masvingo with a 3-year-old kid. He does not have any other dependents who stay with him.

Kenneth is in the business of buying and selling shoes and clothes in Masvingo town. He has been in this business for 4 years . He is working with the help of his wife. Kenneth has requested for a loan of $250.00 to buy shoes and clothes for resale. With the income generated from this loan he will be able to provide food for his family. He says the challenge faced in the business is competition in the market. He is planning to open a shop in Masvingo Central Business District in future.

loans.use: to buys shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Adeliada

texts.en:
Adeliada is 43 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Adeliada is married and has five children.

Adeliada is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. 

In 2011, Adeliada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Adeliada wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Jehová

texts.es: Jehová de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro por eso se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener  las mejores cosechas; comercia en la localidad en todas las zonas aledañas a donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles además con un servicio inigualable; Jehová es un hombre emprendedor, muy activo siempre dispuesto a salir adelante y llegar al éxito, en la última cosecha tuvo muchas pérdidas y desea recuperarse en esta temporada de siembra, necesita de capital para la compra de insumos pues solo así aumentara la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Jehová es muy responsable y con buenas referencias de pago, asegura saldara la deuda a tiempo y a la vez darle a su familia una vida mejor.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 21. She volunteers in her nearby secondary school teaching life skills to students. She is not married. Catherine lives with her parents in Kilosa district. Catherine has a grocery business selling home usage products. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by buying varieties of home products in bulk and selling them in her shop. The profit will be used to pay her young brother`s school fees and tertiary education for herself.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying varieties of home products in bulk

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is 32 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns him 11,000 KES per month. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools and farm inputs. This will help him to have a better agricultural harvest for supplying the market so as to meet his client and family needs.

Duke plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to a higher level of education. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools and farm inputs for a better agricultural harvest.

loans.name: Martha Josefina

texts.en:
My name is Martha Jossefina. I have a store in my community’s downtown. I’ve been in this type of business for several years. It provides me with the necessary income to contribute to my family’s expenses and my children’s education. My biggest wish is to stock up my store, in order to offer a variety of products to my clients, and that way improve my business’ profits.

Loan Use: Purchase sugar, butter, rice, coffee, flour, beans, corn, pasta, dairy products, meat, and sausage.

Mi Nombre es Martha Jossefina, cuento con un negocio en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con mis gastos familiares y educacion de mis hijos, mi mayor deseo es surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clites y de esa forma mejorar las utilidades de mi negocio.

loans.use: compra de azucar, manteca, arroz, cafe, harina, frijoles, maiz, pastas, Productos Lacteos, carnes y embutidos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of selling sugarcane.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of medical items, including blood pressure machine, glucometer, trays and drugs

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
A 50-year-old widow with 2 children, Mrs. Sin H. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To meet her family’s daily needs, and especially her children’s education, Mrs. Sin H. rents different rooms of her house to the people in her area, earning around $5 each day.

Recently, Mrs. Sin H. has applied for a loan which helps her to repair and build more rooms in order to fulfill her tenants’ needs. She is confident that she will expand her rental business and provide a good quality of life for her family one day.

loans.use: To repair and build her rental rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
My name is Mariam B. and I am a widow with six children. I make jewelry tassels for $60 a month. My children had to quit their studies due to the financial repercussions that took place after their father’s death. They were forced to do menial jobs for meager wages.

A couple of years ago, one of my sons bought a bull cart by taking out a loan from ASASAH, a microfinance institution. He obtains orders from various wholesalers to transport goods from one place to another on his bull cart. The income from this business is just enough to feed and clothe the family members. This year he plans to buy another bull cart to increase the income. He will put aside money with this extra income for his sisters’ weddings. Please lend us US$ 400 to purchase a bull cart.

loans.use: Buy a bull cart

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo V., age 38, works selling containers of gasoline, earning around $8/day in revenue. Her husband, age 40, is a policeman, making $1.60 per day. They have four children. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a small van for her business’ transportation to pick up the gasoline and deliver it to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a van to expand her gasoline sales business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three small children who are still in primary school. The children help Norma with the housework.

Norma has a store from which she sells all types of essential goods. She began her business activities several years ago with a small amount of capital that they managed to save from her husband’s work as a walking salesperson.

Currently, she works attending to business in the store while her husband makes door-to-door sales, delivering their merchandise to other businesses in the area: her husband also works nights as a security guard in a private house.

Norma is asking for a loan in order to buy a freezer, with which she will be able to sell cold drinks which at this time of year in summer are in high demand.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Norma esta casada y tiene 3 hijos menores que están aun en la escuela primaria. Los hijos ayudan a la Sra. Norma en las labores de la casa.

Norma posee una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Inicio sus actividades comerciales hace varios años con un pequeño capital que consiguieron de un trabajo que realizaba su marido como vendedor ambulante .

Actualmente ella se dedica a atender el negocio mientras que el marido realiza ventas a domicilio, repartiendo las mercaderías a otros negocios de la zona; además, el señor trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular por las noches.

Norma solicita un crédito para comprar un freezer, de este modo podrá vender bebidas bien frías que en esta época de verano son bastante solicitadas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom S., age 46, works with her husband selling motorcycle spare parts to the people in their area, making around $7.50 profit. She has two children enrolled in school. She would like to request this loan of $1200 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to expand her inventory and meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
For more than 10 years, Vicente has earned a living from farming in the "comunidad" of Achuapa, the place where he was raised near the Nicaraguan city of Leon. He's a married men with four children who study at a small school that they have to walk very far to reach.

The problem that Vicente faces is that there's no electricity in his neighborhood because it's a rural area with few basic services. He's looking for a way to solve the problem and he's applying to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him [to withdraw from this debt for a solar panel?] so that he can use the power from it for household chores and provide light for his children to study.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Vicente López por mas de 10 años se ha dedicado al negocio de agropecuario en la ciudad de León específicamente en la comunidad de Achuapa que es el lugar donde se ha criado desde pequeño. Es un caballero casado y con cuatro hijos estudiando en una pequilla escuela que a diario tienen que caminar una larga distancia para llegar a ella.

Una problemática atravesada por el señor Vicente es la ausencia de energía eléctrica en su localidad por ser una zona rural que no cuenta con estos servicios básicos. Por este motivo, el señor Vicente busca la manera de solucionar este problema y para ello acude a Ceprodel para que le brinde crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda y así aprovechar la energía tanto para los quehaceres del hogar como para que sus hijos estudien sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
I am Nazira A. Khan from Lahore, a city famous for its gardens in Pakistan. I have six children, four boys and two girls, three of whom still live with me. My husband is a retired officer, and one of my sons drives a loading van to transport goods on order. However, his van’s condition is deteriorating and requires immediate repairs.

My loan group friends are: Shamim B., who wants to buy a floor grinding machine; Naseem S. and Saira, who both operate separate beauty salons, and Maqsooda M., who wants to buy a cow. All of us have been together for a year, and during this period we have learned to be punctual, responsible, and frugal, as well as healthy and confident.

loans.use: For the repair of our loading van.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana wants to use her loan to buy more materials like polyester and linen to avoid price hikes in her products. She has been selling materials used in making dresses for schoolchildren. She is forty-eight years old and a mother of five children. Two of the children are in school. With this loan, she plans to increase savings to enable her continue to pay for the children’s education. Christiana is a member of the group called Beloved. Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials like polyester, linen, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is 45-years old and is married man with two children. He is in the same business as his wife. Many Ghanaian farmers use cutlass and hoes to farm during the farming or planting season, and  the demand for simple farm tools are very high. Kwame will use his loan to buy more cutlass and hoes to sell to farmers who need the tools to work. He is a member of the group called Believers. Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy farm tools to sell to farmers

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar N. is a nurse by training, but isn’t practicing nursing. She works in her own store where she sells food products. Yavan, the city where she lives, is far from Dushanbe city, and products are available only in Dushanbe or in the center of Yavan. Her store is located in her village – and is the only store in the region. For this reason, Dilbar decided to increase her stock turnover and change her assortment of products. But this can only happen if she gets a loan. She expects to be able to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Нуриддинова Дилбар медсестра. Но по специальности не работает. Работает в собственном магазине. Продает продукты питания. Яван расположен далеко от города Душанбе , а продукты можно купить только там или в центре Явана. Магазин Дильбар расположен в их кишлаке . Он является единственным магазином в округе. Поэтому Дильбар решила увеличить товарооборот и изменить ассортимент товара. НО это возможно лишь после получения кредита. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar, a single mother of two (aged 5 and 25), sold clothing and food before she took out her first Esperanza Bank of Loan two cycles ago, but she says that her experience has allowed both parts of her business to grow, because she can now offer a much wider selection.  Also, the opportunities that Esperanza have been offered have taught her much about God and getting through hard times.

loans.use: Comedor Nena (Restaurant and clothing sales)

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura E. tiene 48 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida y ubicada en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Arroyo y Estero.

Comenta la señora que con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotación rápida, como ser azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, esto hizo que su negocio este bien surtido y de esa forma ser más atractivo para la visitas de clientes potenciales.

Su objetivo a corto plazo es la de diversificar sus productos incorporando la venta de bebidas heladas de todas las marcas, comos así también la venta de comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, y tiene pensado fabricar y vender helados artesanales, en su domicilio, ya que una de las demandas no satisfecha en la ciudad es la venta de helados de buena calidad.

Ella hoy solicita un nuevo crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías pues con la venta de estos ella esta ahorrando para poder cumplir con todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura E. is 48 years old, married, with 2 children. She is the owner of a well-stocked store located in the center of Arroyo and Estero city. She says that with the loans she has received from the Fundación Paraguaya she was able to stock a large quantity of products that sell quickly, such as sugar, tea, beef, chicken, oil, noodles, rice and other products consumed daily. This resulted in her business being well stocked and therefore more attractive to potential customers to visit. Her short term goal is to diversify her products incorporating the sale of all brands of cold drinks, and also sell fast food such as hamburgers, dumplings, chicken, and she is thinking about making and selling frozen treats in her home, as one of the things missing in her city is the selling of good quality ice cream. Today she is asking for a new loan to increase her stock of merchandise because with the sales of the items she is saving money to be able to meet all her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, a variety of beverages, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda Elsa M. O. tiene cuarentaicuatro años,  vive en la avenida Campo Bello sin número del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de L a Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, los padres no nos educaron por falta de Centros educativos, manifiesta.
Se caso de dieciocho años con Hober Salomón Vega y tiene ocho hijos de los cuales cuatro son estudiantes y cuatro tienen trabajos independientes.
La señora compra y vende animales, los compra vivos y los vende en carne, ella manifiesta que gracias al Banco Progresistas, aprendió a ser independiente y a trabajar sola, antes dependía de su esposo, de tal manera que cuando recibió el primer préstamo de 300 soles fue muy cuidadosa en su inversión compró cerdos y de allí se capitalizó y continuo sola, devolvió su préstamo en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará una vaca y la venderá en carne (al por menor).
Yolanda pertenece comedor popular Corazón de María  y es socia del Banco Comunal Progresistas.
Su gran sueño es que Manuela Ramos crezca mucho más y pueda otorgar préstamos mucho mayores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda Elsa M. O. is 44 years old. She lives on the Campo Bello Avenue in the Mache district of Otuzco province, in the Peruvian Libertad Department. She completed primary school but her  parents were not able to send her through more schooling because they  did not have adequate access to schools in their neighborhood. She has been married to Hober Salomón since she was 18, and she has 8 children. Four of them are students and the other four have independent jobs. She buys animals and sells their meat, and thanks to Banco Progresistas (a local bank), she learned to be independent and run the business alone instead of depending on her husband as she did before. When she received her first loan of 300 soles, she invested it very carefully. She bought pigs, made a profit, and went on to working alone. She was able to repay the loan in four months. With this loan of 1,500 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy a cow and retail sell its meat. She works for the local soup kitchen Corazón de María and is member of the Banco Comunal Progesistas. Her dream is for Manuela Ramos to keep growing so that the organization can grant her bigger loans.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle (a cow).

loans.name: Rup Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Rup Laxmi S. is a tailor in the town of Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in a government office, and her sons are now studying in the higher secondary school. 

She opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs. S. took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her home.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150.00) to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income to improve her standard of living and for her son's education.

loans.use: Buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr:
Madame T. Hodalo est née le 31 décembre 1968 à Tchébébé dans la préfecture de Sotouboua au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente du charbon de bois dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis son enfance et a pris goût après qu’elle soit mariée. Expérimentée dans le domaine, elle connaît tous les risques de son métier.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock avec 30 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hodalo T. was born on December 31, 1968 in Tchébébé, in the Sotouboua prefecture in Togo. She's married and the mother of two children. Her business consists in selling charcoal in the Agoè neighborhood. She started this activity during her childhood, and has acquired a taste for it after getting married. Experienced in this field, she knows all the risks involved by her profession. This first loan she's seeking will enable her to resupply her stock with 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Bahry

texts.en:
Bahry O. was born in 1955 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Now she lives and works in Khujand. 

Mrs. O. has been an active client of our program since 2007. She recommended herself as a responsible and reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. 

Mrs. O. applied to MicroInvest when she heard about her sister's succesful loan history. She took the loan so she could improve her business terms significantly. Afterward, she opened a trade outlet in which she sells eggs. Mrs. O. has been in business selling eggs for 11 years. She is a school teacher by professional background, so she engages in this low-cost work to have the additional family income. 

Now, Mrs. O. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of 400 STJ for 1 month to make a trade counter.

loans.use: Trade counter

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: Jonny es promotor de venta de una de la cadena de supermercados la Colonia mas reconocida de Nicaragua, ya cuenta con tres años de laborar en esa área.  Los planes que tiene para su familia es poder mejorar su nivel de vida, espera poder montar en un lapso corto de tiempo su propio negocio que consiste en una carnicería, así de esta manera mejorar e incrementar los ingresos en su hogar. Tienen  37 años de edad, Soltero, sin hijos, habitante del Barrio  Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de una de sus metas esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá cambiar el techo de su casa, lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros, para poder hacer el cambio del techo, lo cual será de  gran beneficio y logros en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Jonny is a salesman for "la Colonia", one of the best-known chains of supermarkets in Nicaragua. He has been doing this job for three years. He wants to improve his family's living standard and hopes to open his own business shortly, a butcher shop. He will then be able to make home improvements and increase his income. He is 37 years old, single and has no children. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood of Managua. In order to meet his goals, he is requesting a loan to be repaid in nine months. He will use the loan to replace the roof of his home, and will need to buy building materials such as zinc, purlins, beams and so on in order to change the roof. This will benefit him greatly and will count as an achievement in his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to fix the roof of his home.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Mr. Horn K. lives in Kna Roung village in Takeo province, where he drives a motor taxi. His wife, Mrs. Ouk Sa Um, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. In order to earn more money, Mr. Horn K. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living standards with this loan. He is 49 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. His second child is a security guard and his youngest attends the local school. His wife is seen here with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. sells medicine to his customers. The demands for his medicine are high and he hopes to meet all their demands. He is requesting the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase additional medicine to sell. He is 49 years old and married, with 4 children. He says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William A.-Ansah is 49 years old. He is married and has to six children, - three males and three females who are all currently in junior high and primary school. His wife works with him. William lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. 
William owns a palm plantation. He does not sell the raw harvested palm fruits but adds value to it by producing palm oil. However, he procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production. He distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce in bulk and distribute to his increasing number of customers. He aspires to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora N. is 27 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Nigora been raising cattle for three years. She tries to invest as much time as possible in her animals. She tries to bathe and vaccinate her animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe the rams and it's not easy to reach. But without a doubt, the results please her: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a big source of satisfaction. Now Nigora plans to invest the money that she is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of her animals. She will then generate more income, and with it, improve her family’s quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Miki

texts.en: Miki T., 29, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the food stall business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about US $66).  SPBD loans are Miki’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy food stall inventory

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with four children. She rents a space at the central department store in her small city and sells children’s clothing. Her profit is 2,300 UAH per month.

Alla has been in this business for 15 years. During this time she has been able to win many repeat clients. She enjoys selling children's clothing and helps the parents to choose good clothing for their children. 

Alla would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and spend it on her family needs.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of children's clothing

loans.name: Benk Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benk est composé de dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, époux et enfants dans le village de Djoutièbougou dans la préfecture de Bougouni, région de Sikasso  république du Mali.
Elles se sont connues par des relations professionnelle et de mariage et  font essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs capacités  financières enfin de faire assez de stocks, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et elles n’ont connues aucun problème de remboursement.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 200 kg de beurre de karité, 300 kg de graines de néré. Les produits sont achetés auprès des paysans du village de Djoutièbougou et environs pour être ensuite revendus sur le marché de Bougouni en détail au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de revendeurs.
Avec ce prêt ces femmes  envisagent chacune obtenir un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera réinjecté  selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The group Benk is composed of ten married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. The women live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, husbands, and children in the village of Djoutièbougou, in Bougouni prefecture, Sikasso region, the Republic of Mali. They know one another by ties of profession and marriage. And they essentially do commerce in condiments of all sorts. Intending to increase their financial capabilities in order to have enough inventory, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan and have experienced no problems at all making loan payments. With this loan, the group members intend to buy 200 kg of shea nut butter and 300 kg of néré nuts. The goods are purchased from village peasants in and around Djoutièbougou and then are sold retail at the Bougouni marketplace to customers composed essentially of women and retailers, cash or credit accepted. The group members each envision obtaining a profit of 20,000 francs CFA per month that will be re-injected into their business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell condiments

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Назар Бакиров проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Назар более 30 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает рис, пшеницу и бахчевые растения. Назару приходится трудно, т.к. у него большая семья и он имеет сына с ограниченными возможностями. Поэтому клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева, а полученный урожай продать.
texts.en:
Nazar B. lives in the Rumy district. He is 44 years old, married and has 8 children. Nazar has been involved in agriculture for over 30 years old. He grows rice, wheat and melon plants. At times, it is difficult for Nazar because he has a big family and a disabled son. This is why our client is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel for sowing. He will them sell the resulting harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 45-year-old married mother of six. Four of her children attend school while the other two work. She is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew in her community. She also sells meat pies. Joyce started her operation about ten years ago in order to take care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because she has inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use this loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice so she can produce her goods in larger quantities and increase her efficiency. Joyce believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support and provide for her family and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, meat, bags of rice, and firewood.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan I. is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells shoes and bags. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: C. is 50-year-old married woman and mother who is devoted to her five children, three of whom are students while the other two are married and have already started new homes. Today, C. owns a bicycle which she uses to sell a few products directly at her customers' houses. She sells items like vegetables, pork, and other meats, and is typically earning around of $2.50 a day in order to meet her family’s living needs. A portion of her family’s daily expense is contributed by her husband who makes fishing equipment for sale. C. is hardly transporting her wares to sell because her bicycle is slow. Therefore, she would like a loan of $300 to buy an old motor, which she will use to pick up her items to sell more quickly. Note: C.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an old motor to use to pick up her items to sell more quickly

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter. Both are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Yaa lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Yaa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. Yaa sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Aurelia De

texts.es: La familia de Aurelia está compuesta por cuatro  integrantes, sus tres hijos menores de edad y ella, viven en  casa propia. Aurelia se dedica al comercio de frutas en su propio puesto del mercado central de la localidad. La competencia en sus actividades es media  ya que hay otras personas con las mismas actividades. El crédito fue destinado como capital de trabajo con lo cual tendrá mayores ingresos. Su historial crediticio en sus anteriores operaciones fue excelente.
texts.en:
Aurelia’s family consists of four members. She and her three dependent children live in their own home. She sells fruit from a vending stall in the city’s central market. Competition in her line of business is average, since there are three other vendors who sell the same types of products.

Aurelia will use her loan as working capital to help her increase her earnings. Her credit history on previous loans is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo G. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Arnulfo owns and operates a business providing motor transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Arnulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Arnulfo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Gladys Reyna

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas
Gladis es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Gladis tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, además Gladis vende comida en la puerta de su tienda, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gladis son ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow his transportation business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“If there’s a will, there’s a way.” says Lydia, a businesswoman who is doing everything to help her husband to improve their family's living conditions. She is married and blessed with four children who are all married college graduates. Even though they have their own families, she still helps them.

Lydia sells different kinds of snacks, fruits and vegetables. She also ventured into a direct-sales business (selling directly to customers from a catalog of products) for additional income. For 12 years, she never grown tired of working to meet the needs of her children. She has been selling different commodities in their village and she is earning an amount sufficient for her family’s needs. 

Lydia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to develop her business. She will use the loan in purchasing more vegetables to sell. She also plans to purchase more products from MSE Cosmetics and Board Walk for her direct-sales business. She hopes that her loan will be granted because it will contribute a lot to the development of her business.

loans.use: Addtional capital to purchase more vegetables and to expand her direct-sales business

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es: Don chepito como lo conocen en su comunidad el es originario del cantón Chotacaj su actividad principal es maestro de educacion primaria en la escuela oficial del canton Juchanep el necesita del apoyo de la institucion para un credito que le servira para la remodelacion de su vivienda con el unico objetivo de mejora la calidad de vida de sus hijos
texts.en:
Don Chepito is originally from the district of Chotacaj and is known in his community. He is an elementary school teacher in the district of Juchanep. He needs the assistance of the Institution and is requesting a loan for a home remodeling project. His sole objective is to improve the quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for remodeling his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy higher quality sheep.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.en:
Juan A. has been selling vegetables in the Mayoreo Market in Managua for eight years. He sells a wide variety of vegetables including peppers, beets, ginger, potatos and more. He would like a loan to increase his inventory by purchasing yucca (a starchy root vegetable) and quequisque (another typical root vegetable). 

Juan has been working with CEPRODEL for about two years and has had about 10 small loans.  He says that the loans have helped him increase his inventory and improve his business.  His stall is less than a block from CEPRODEL’s office in the market. The stall consists of large baskets full of his products and a cloth overhead that provides shade. 

Juan, 41, and his partner have four children in their care, three are still in school.  Before working in the market, Juan was a driver.

loans.use: Buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lilia

texts.es: Blanca Lilia M. y su esposo tienen 2 combis en el que las utiliza para transportar niños y jóvenes a su escuela. En este momento están trabajando muy bien solo que quieren tramitar el permiso federal de una de ellas, que el año pasado la compro con un préstamo que se le otorgo de esta institución. En el crédito que tuvieron realizaron sus pagos puntuales en que están agradecidos por el apoyo ya que pudieron obtener un nuevo transporte para su beneficio económico
texts.en:
Blanca Lilia M. and her husband have two combis which they use to transport children and young people to school. At the moment the vehicles are working very well, but Blanca wants to obtain the documentation for one of them, like she bought last year with a loan from this institution. The couple made their repayments punctually, and they are grateful for the financial support which enabled them to obtain a new vehicle and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: federal permit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Fredy, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad es separado y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, el realiza trabajos de construcción civil, el siempre está tras de las instituciones buscando nuevas obras y proyectos para realizarlos, nuestro socio desea comprar algunos materiales entre ellos un  draibol para el trabjo, nuestro socio está como independiente desde el 2008. Nuestro socio comprará unos materiales para construcción civil.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Fredy is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Vision de Urubamba". Urubamba is located in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, 1 hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Fredy is 40 years old and separated. He has two children who are 15 and 10 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible person who works in civic construction. He is always after the institutions looking for new works and projects to build. He would like to buy some materials including drywall for his work. He has been independent since 2008. Fredy is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ticana Gaspar

texts.pt:
Ticana Gaspar M. nasceu em Manhiça, tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 24 aos 31 anos. 3 Dos seus filhos estão na universidade e os restantes estão empregados, responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa, não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque tem que pagar as despesas dos seus filhos que na universidade, uma vez que seu marido teve problemas no serviço e perdeu o emprego.

Devido a falta de condições financeiras Ticana teve que interromper os estudos na 8ª classe, anos depois sai de Manhiça para  Marracuene com seu marido em emissão de serviço este que era director da Agricultura daquele Distrito onde governou durante 5 anos.Ticana porque tinha um nível de escolaridade adequado o administrador convida lhe para trabalhar como secretária particular dele, mas seu esposo e transferido para Vila de Namaacha na fronteira da Suazilândia e ela não consegue separar a vida profissional da familiar, assim abandona o emprego. Chegado a Namaacha com o fundo colectado ela inicia com o negocio de criação de pintos e conta com ajuda do seu esposo que e técnico agrónomo, para além de criar é proprietária de uma barraca de refeições, os pintos precisam de muita atenção ela não tem horário fixo do trabalho tem criado no máximo 100x5caixas de pintos gastando 40.000.00mt e revende cada a 100.00mt, tem criado em fases para poder vender alternadamente. Tem como melhor produto o frango já preparado que vende em sua barraca tem tido um lucro de 10.000.00mt mensalmente

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Ticana na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt foi usado para comprar pintos, o segundo de 12.000.00mt foi para reforçar na criação e pede este terceiro de 20.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto porque para além de negociante e também funcionária do CMVN (conselho municipal).
texts.en:
Ticana Gaspar M. was born in Manhiça. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children between 24 and 31 years old. 3 of her children attend university and the others are employed. She is responsible for her niece who lives with her in her house. She is not able to save any money because she has to pay for her children's university expenses; she has do to this as her husband lost his job after having problems at work. Due to the lack of financial means, Ticana had to discontinue her studies in the 8th grade. Years later, she left Manhiça for Marracuene with her husband due to his job as Agriculture Director in that District where he governed for 5 years. Because Ticana had level of schooling that was deemed adequate, the administrator invited her to work as his secretary. However, he husband was transferred to the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland; she wasn't able to have a separate professional and family life, so she left her job. After she arrived in Namaacha, she used the money that she had collected to start a business raising baby chicks. She counts on the help of her husband, who is an expert agronomist. Besides this business, she is also the owner of a meal stand. The chicks require a lot of attention; she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She raises at most 5 boxes with 100 chicks each, spending 40,000 MZN. She resells each box for 100 MZN. She has raised them in different stages in order to alternate her sales. Her best product that she sells in her meal stand is already-cooked chicken. From her stand, she makes of monthly profit of 10,000 MZN. This is Ticana's 3rd loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first loan was for 15,000 MZN, which she used to buy chicks. The second loan of 12,000 MZN was used to reinforce her chick-raising business. She has asked for this third loan of 20,000 MZN for the same purpose. She is confident that she can pay off the loan before the deadline arrives, as she is also an employee of CMVN (Municipal Council) in addition to being a businesswoman.
