Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise and sell chickens

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph owns an electrical appliances shop in Karuguuza, Uganda managed by his wife with whom he has three children aged six, three, and eight months. He has operated his shop for three years now and has seen it grow steadily with good, considerable profit.

Joseph is a civil servant with the local government. He dreams of being the supplier of electrical appliances in Karuguuza town as a wholesaler. He plans to use the loan from Hofokam to purchase electrical wire, kettles and flat irons for resale, items which he says have the biggest demand.

loans.use: purchase electrical wires, kettles and flat irons for reselling

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris resides in Albur, Bohol with her family. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She sells fish for a living. Her husband goes out to the sea to catch fish and she sells all his catch at the market. Sometimes, she walks around her home to sell fish. She prays that God will continue to strengthen her and her husband so that they will be able to provide for their family’s needs.

Iris is a new member of CEVI. She said that she joined because of its low interest rate. She applied for a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to buy fishnets and other fishing materials.

loans.use: To purchase fishnets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments,  de  bouillie de céréales  et  de médicaments.
Maïmouna C.  qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires (tomate et oignon frais + de l’huile + sel + gombo + poivre +  cube maggi +  concentrée de tomate etc. ) Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les condiments sont revendus au  marché du quartier SANOUBOUGOU I et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA group are married women, on average 45 years old with three children, living in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs in Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They conduct several activities, among which the sale of food condiments, cereal mush and medication. Maïmouna C. is one of the group members who trades in food condiments. Her loan will enable her to buy four packages of food condiments (fresh tomatoes and onions, oil, salt, gombos, pepper, Maggi cubes, tomato paste, etc.). She gets her supplies from the main market in Sikasso and from the surrounding area. The condiments are resold by family members at the SANOUBOUGOU I borough market to women customers, and mainly for cash. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 15,000 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Mrs. Ol Seoun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of nine people in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ol S. is the village bank president selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Ol S. is a fish and pork seller in a local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish and pork for resale. Mrs. Ol S. is a widow with a child who works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more fish and pork for resale

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn H. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juvelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from which she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Juvelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Juvelyn joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juvelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. She would like to use any additional profits to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
M. Joséphine est une femme de 48 ans, veuve, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est négligeable mais elle sait lire et écrire. Elle a mis au monde quatre enfants, le plus âgée a 27 ans et son cadet a 13 ans. Deux de ses enfants ont étudié jusqu’au niveau de secondaire.

Cette famille vit de l’agriculture et l’élevage des bovins et son milieu de vie est favorable pour l’élevage car c’est tout près du lac Kivu ou le pâturage ne manque pas même dans la saison sèche. Client d’Amasezerano Community Banking depuis 2009, elle a contracté un prêt avec celui-ci pour acheter une vache de la race améliorée. Grâce à ses épargnes elle a pu payer le minerval pour ses deux enfants, et mettre le pavement dans sa maison qui n’était pas pavée. Elle veut avoir dans l’avenir dix vaches de race amélioré car elles sont bénéfiques que les races locale et améliorer l'aimantation par le lait. Les épargnes venant de ces bénéfices lui permettra d’amener les deux autres enfants qui restent a l’école.
texts.en:
Joséphine M. is a 48 year old widow who was born in Rubavu district in Rwanda's Western Province. She has little schooling, but she can read and write. She has four children; the oldest is 27 and the youngest is 13. Two of her children have been to high school. This is a family that lives from agriculture and raising cattle. They have a good location near Kivu lake where there is always pasture even during the dry season. Mrs. M. received a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in 2009 to buy a cow of a better breed. Thanks to her investment, she has paid the tuition fees for her two children and put flooring in her house, which had a dirt floor before. She hopes to acquire 10 better breed cows in the future because these are more profitable than local cows and produce milk, which improves nutrition. The return on this investment will allow her to support the other two children who are still in school.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en: Anjelina Satariano is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and first class clothes at the marketplace. She is requesting a loan to stock shoes and sandles to sell.  Anjelina is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop and purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Stock shoes and sandles to sell

loans.name: Lallen

texts.en:
Lallen A., from the village of Delapa, Sibutad, is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lallen owns and operates a a general store selling basic household items in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lallen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 7,000 PHP to purchase new stock for the store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase new stocks

loans.name: Gudilla

texts.en:
Gudilla S. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Camiguin Province. She is 61 years old. Gudilla is widowed and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Gudilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gudilla has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gudilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gudilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gudilla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gudilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan T. H. P. is 39 years old. She has 2 children who are attending high school. She is running a shop that sells materials for construction and water pipes. Her business is very good. As a client of Seda credit program, she has effectively used her loans. Currently, she needs a loan to invest in her shop.

Ha N. T. is 35 years old with 1 child. She has a fashion shop. She wants a loan to buy clothing as material.
Hau T. N. is 56 years old. She is managing a range of houses for rent. She wants to have a loan to buy some furniture for the houses.
La  T. N. is 39 years old. She has a fashion shop. She needs a loan to buy more new, designed dresses for her shop .
Van T. C. is 50 years old. She is running a shop that sell clothes for office staff. She wants a loan to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Maren Ole

texts.en:
For the last three years, Maren has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town. He is 25 years old, is married to Memosambi K., and they have one child.

Maren was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy more animals which he will rear and sell later at a profit. The Maasai people in Kenya are members of an ethnic group called Plain Nilotes; they are nomads and are identified with the act of rearing animals which they do with a passion.

Maren is planning to save most of the profit so that he can build a nice house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more animals which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine H. is a young entrepreneur selling women’s clothing and shoes. She lives happily with her 3 brothers and retired parents. While her two younger brothers are serving in the army, her older brother is helping her run the business. 

Marine rents a shop in the busy city market. This happy and enthusiastic young lady supports herself and her family with the income from the business. She is very eager to add fresh inventory to satisfy her longstanding customers. Marine is planning to make a purchase of new inventory, for which she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Sochanda

texts.en:
Mrs. Sochanda C. is 21 year-old and her husband, Mr. Sokchan Khai is 24 year-old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 15 kilometers. They have just been married this year and have no children yet.  

Sochanda sells duck eggs; she buys egg from the fellow villagers for resale in the market. Her husband is a driver. She applies for her first loan of $250 to purchase a second hand motorbike to carry duck eggs for resale. 

Photo: Sochanda is sitting on the motorbike which she wanted to buy because she bought it from her neighbor, but she does not give money yet. So, she asks for the loan to pay for purchasing.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike to transport duck eggs to market.

loans.name: C4588 Abiyemeje Group

texts.en:
Theddy is 55 years old. Theddy is the leader of a group called "abiyemeje."  This group is known for selling natural medicines and they have been in this business for a long time.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Theddy and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, this team will expand the business through purchasing natural medicines.  With these additional natural medicines, this team will earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in their business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of natural medicines

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Vilquechico” ubicado en el distrito de Vilquechico, provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 06 hijos, realizó estudios de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 meses, el primer préstamo fue S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de pescados y pastoreo de ganados.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar animales para su negocio. 
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital para mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the “Las Flores de Vilquechico” (Flowers of Vilquechico) community bank which is located in Vilquechico district, Huancané province, in the department of Puno.  She is 49 years old, married and has 6 children.  She completed her primary education.

Eusebia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 months.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling fish and shepherding livestock.

She is requesting a new loan for 500 nuevos soles which she will use to buy animals for her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: To buy animals for her business

loans.name: Emly

texts.en:
Emly L. is 57 years old, married and supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Pasil, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. 

Emly is now borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase fishing equipment. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Emly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Nelson Norberto

texts.es: Nelson Norberto G. E. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja comercializando productos varios. Nelson se dedica a la venta de peluches, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por colegios, mercados, parques y otros lugares más, los precios son muy accesibles y así también cuenta con diseños muy llamativos. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de peluches, Nelson espera aprovechar al máximo esta temporada navideña en la que sus ventas aumentan, por lo que desea contar con el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Nelson Norberto G. E. is 33 years old.  He lives in Delgado City in the San Salvador department. He lives with his wife who works selling various products.  

Nelson sells stuffed animals.  He sells in an itinerant manner; and he sells at schools, markets, parks, and other places.  His prices are very accessible, and he also has very appealing designs.

He is requesting a loan to be able to buy a greater variety of stuffed animals.  Nelson hopes to take the greatest advantage of this Christmas season when sales increase.  That is why he wishes to have the money he needs to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals to sell

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 32 years old, married and has two children. Currently, two of her children attend school. Her husband is a driver. Fatuma sells cooking oil, rice, salt, fish and vegetables, which she has done for three years. Fatuma will use the loan to add more items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatuma hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anye

texts.en:
Anye A. was born on 01/02/1947. He is married to Lum Mary and they are blessed with three children and one is under the age of 15. He lives in a small house of three rooms with his family. He lives in Ndamukongstreet, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Anye has faced some challenges in life. Amongst which are the inability to meet the basic necessities of his family like clothing, food, transportation and educating himself and his children. He has had difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business to sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a gardening business, and with this loan he is going to buy seedlings and farm products. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old farm of his; therefore, he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is also certain that this business will succeed because the products he produces are highly demanded in the market. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford all food ingredients at low or no cost. 

Anye will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater for the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, manure, farm tools, clear farm and buy firewood.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
el señor Jose Francisco G. es una persona trabajadora y muy dedicado a su familia, el se dedica a la reparacion de llantas y venta de llantas usadas, actividad que realiza desde hace año y medio en su casa de habitacion, su establecimiento es muy visitado ya que se encuentra en un lugar de facil acceso para todas las personas que vienen de la frontera del Espino, esta ubicado a orillas de la carretera panamercana.
Jose es bien honrado y muy responsable, trabaja mucho para poder crecer en su negocio, el da servicio las 24 horas del dia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, neumaticos, parchos, pegamento, limas etc.
con las ganancias que obtenga desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco García is a hard working person who is very dedicated to his family.  He repairs tires and sells used tires, a business he’s been in for a year and a half and which is located at home.  His establishment is popular because it’s located in an accessible spot for everyone who’s coming from the border at El Espino.  It’s located along the Panamerican Highway.

José is quite honest and very responsible.  He works a lot so that his business will grow.  He provides services 24 hours a day.

He will use the loan to buy tires, inner tubes, patches, adhesive, files, etc.

With profits obtained he wants to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy used tires, inner tubes, patches, adhesive, oil and files.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda D. is a single woman who lives in Brgy. Tan-awan, Oslob, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating fish vending and livestock businesses. Rosenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosenda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for future house repair. Rosenda D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of fish selling business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Ali runs a small grocery store. He is engaged and wants to get married next summer.
Ali took a loan from FATEN to purchase a large variety of goods and expand his business in order to have a better income and be able to cover the wedding expenses and buy the items he needs for his house.

Ali appears in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of goods to sell

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who hope to increase their income to improve their families' lives. The  members have selected Mrs. Theng as group leader. She and her husband earn their living using their own car as a taxi. Mrs. Theng also earns her living by knitting and weaving. With all their businesses, this couple still earns a small income to support and improve their lives. In order to increase income to improve the family’s condition, Theng would like to ask for a loan to buy groceries to support her new grocery store business.  This couple has two children who attend a local school.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable   ella es divorciada, tiene una   tienda de  abarrotes  de  la  cual  obtiene sus ingresos para  sacar adelante a sus hijos ya  que  son lo mas importante  en  su  vida  y  desea   brindarles  una  excelente  calidad  de   vida , en esta  ocasión requiere    el crédito  para   comprar  mercancía  para  su  negocio y  de  esta  manera  obtener    ingresos  y  poder  brindar  una mayor   variedad  de  productos  para  sus  clientes.
texts.en: Carolina is a very hardworking and responsible person. She is divorced. She has a grocery store from which she makes her income to help her children have a better life. Seeing as they are the most important part of her life, and she wants to provide them with an excellent quality of life, she requests a loan at this time to buy merchandise for her business. This will help her to make money and be able to offer a better variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vestiline Group

texts.en:
Kenedy G. is single and in his early thirties. For the past year, he has run a general store. Every day, he works from 7:30 in the morning to 9:00 at night and is able to make a small monthly profit. Kenedy is a member of the group “Vestiline,” which is comprised of 15 members. The group members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In this picture, Kenedy is in the front row wearing a yellow and black t-shirt.

This will be Kenedy’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He successfully repaid his first loan which he used to increase his shop’s inventory. Kenedy is requesting a loan to buy a second-hand refrigerator. His dream is to have a big store one day, earn enough money, and get married.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand refrigerator

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem K., 49, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. K. sells palm juice, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es:
Gricel forma parte del banco comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” conformado por 14 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de comercio, específicamente venta de ropa interior, zapatos, pan amasado, almuerzos. Pertenecientes a la comuna de Peñalolén, ciudad de Santiago. 
Gricel quien en la foto aparece al fondo del lado derecho del grupo, se encuentra de pie, su cabello está tomado y viste una polera azul. Ella se dedica a la venta de herramientas de construcción, desde hace 2 años en una feria libre. Su horario laboral son los días martes y sábados de 6ºº a 15ºº horas. Las quincenas y fines de mes son las fechas en las que más mercadería vende. Su hermano es quien la ayuda en el traslado de mercadería a la feria y a su casa. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, sin embargo éste negocio no le generaba buenas ganancias.
Gricel compra su mercadería en una distribuidora de herramientas, por lo cual su inversión es a bajo costo. Su padre es quien la acompaña a comprar, ya que conoce más de herramientas.
Con el préstamo comprará herramientas, específicamente; espátulas, flexibles, lianas, guantes y otros.
Sus metas en su negocio son crecer y estabilizarse. Para vender cosas de mayor valor, como maquinarias de construcción. Sus proyecciones son instalarse con una ferretería. 
Gricel vive junto a su esposo e hija de 5 años, en condición de allegados en la casa de sus padres.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son terminar sus estudios medios, ya que sólo terminó la educación básica, además sus anhelos son estudiar gastronomía. Sus motivaciones son surgir, para brindarle a su familia un vida más confortable. 
Gricel está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda y préstamo que recibe de Fondo Esperanza. Además de los aprendizajes de contabilidad y ventas, ya que ha podido internalizarlos en su propio negocio para organizarse. 
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Gricel is a member of the “Luchando por un Sueño” (Fighting for a Dream) community bank which is made up of 14 entrepreneurs who work in commerce.  They sell underwear, shoes, bread and lunches.  They live in Peñalolén, in the city of Santiago.

Gricel appears in the back row of the photo, on the right.  She is standing up.  Her hair is tied back and she is wearing a blue top.  Her business is selling construction tools.  She has been in this business for two years and she makes her sales in a street market.  She works on Tuesdays and Saturdays, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  The second week of each month (when people are paid) and the end of each month are the times when she sells most merchandise.  Her brother helps her to transport her merchandise between the market and her house.  She used to work selling second-hand clothes but that business didn't make good enough profits.

Gricel buys her merchandise from a tool distributor's which means that her investment is low cost.  Her father accompanies her when she goes to buy her merchandise since he knows more about tools.

Gricel will use this loan to buy tools, trowels, gloves, etc.  Her goals are to grow and stabilize her business, and to sell higher-priced products such as construction machinery.  Her plan is to set up a hardware store.

Gricel lives together with her husband and her 5 year-old daughter as guests in her parents' home.  Her dream on a personal level is to finish her secondary education as she only finished elementary school.  She would also like to study cooking.  Her motivation is to get ahead so that she can provide her family with a more comfortable life.

Gricel is very happy and grateful for the help and loan that she is receiving from Fondo Esperanza.  She is also grateful for the training that she has received in accountancy and sales since she has been able to use this knowledge to organize her business.

Peñalolén is located to the east of the Metropolitana region.  It has a number of attractions such as vineyards, historical buildings and nature reserves.  They are transforming the place into a new tourist area within the Metropolitana region.

loans.use: to buy construction tools: trowels, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a divorced woman with 2 school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.  

For the past 4 years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality; during the holiday season she experiences a large number of customers visiting the business. She dreams of establishing a hair-dressing school in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of beauty products for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beauty products for sale

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio de 57 años de edad,vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Herminio es a la venta de embutidos y anticuchos en las afueras del mercado de Cayaltí, por ser un lugar muy transitado y vender productos de calidad sus ventas aumentarán, al igual que su clientela, para poder ampliar su negocio a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la comprá de más embutidos para su venta.  Con las ganancias que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Herminio es una persona empeñosa y responsable que desea que su negocio crezca para brindarle un nivel de vida mejor a su esposa.
texts.en:
Herminio, 57, lives with his wife in his own house that only has water and electricity located in Cayaltí District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone is a farming and livestock raising area.

Herminio sells cured meats and anticuchos (skewered grilled meat) outside the Cayaltí market.  Because of its high level of foot traffic and because he sells quality items his sales will increase as well as his customer base.  To expand the business, he’s thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more cured meats to sell.  Profits he gets will be used to repay the loan and cover his household expenses.

Herminio is a very dedicated, responsible person who wants his business to grow to provide his wife with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cured meats.

loans.name: Julieta De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Julieta de la Concepción de 50 años es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora quien a la edad 14 años se dedica al comercio de frutas, verduras y mariscos. Ella comenzó con su mamá y luego se independizo al casarse, su esposo la respaldo económicamente en negocio hasta que murió y es entonces que decide volver a prestar.
Ella con el crédito compara mercadería para  su negocio con el fin de mejorar su casa y ayudar a su hijo menor de 13 años para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta de la Concepción, 50 years old, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who, at the age of 14, began selling fruits, vegetables, and seafood. She began with her mother and later became independent when she got married. Her husband supported her financially until he died, and it was then that she decided to borrow again.
With the loan, she will buy merchandise for her business in order to improve her home and help her 13-year-old son get ahead.

loans.use: harvest fruits and vegetables and purchase seafood.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Femme de 34ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 16ans à 2ans et a 3 personnes à sa charge, ayant quittée sa scolarité tôt après le décès de son père, étant ainé elle se lança dans la coiffure en 1995. Après avoir reçu son second prêt et faisant preuve d'une bonne gestion elle élargie son activité en se lançant dans les vivre frais au marché en fin mars 2011. Son revenu journalier est de 25000 à 45000 frs par jour.

Avec ce troisième prêt elle aimera agrandir son activité en achetant des vivres frais tels que des cartons de cuisse de poulet, des poissons de mer, des barbillons, des cartons de viande, des cartons de saucissons.

Sa stratégie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans sa boucherie. 

Son ambition est d'aller acheter les produits de cheveux à l'étranger et être grossiste des produit vivre frais car elle pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa mère et de ses frères. Son entourage est content d'elle car elle se débrouille bien.
texts.en:
A 34-year-old woman, married with two children aged sixteen and two, she supports three persons. As an oldest child, she left school early following the death of her father. She started in hairdressing in 1995. After receiving her second loan and demonstrating good management skills, she expanded her business by venturing into selling fresh foods at the market at the end of March 2011. Her daily income is between 25,000 and 45,000 CFA.

With this third loan, she would like to expand her business by purchasing fresh goods such as boxes of chicken thighs, saltwater fish, coxcombs, and boxes of meat and dry sausages.

Her strategy is to promote her products, to offer affordable prices, and to have better products in her butcher shop.

Her ambition is to go purchase hair products abroad and to become a wholesaler for fresh products. She believes she can greatly improve the living conditions of her mother and her brothers. Her relatives are happy with her since she is doing well.

loans.use: to buy chicken thighs and saltwater fish.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 36-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ut and his wife earn a living to support their family by selling everyday items such as combs and toothpicks as well as small kitchen appliances and accessories from a stall near his house. He and his wife have been running their stall for five years. 

Ut intends to take loan to expand his business by buying a greater range of kitchen, bathroom and everyday items to attract more customers. He hopes that, through the loan, the turnover of his business will increase and he will be abL. to generate a higher income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy kitchen and bathroom accessories to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en:
Arzuman lives together with his wife. He is a driver. He does various transportation jobs with his two lorries. 

Unfortunately, the lorries are old and need new accessories to work effectively. 

With the requested loan, Arzuman plans to purchase new wheels for his trucks. With new wheels, Arzuman will do his work with more quality, meet his clients' demand and attract new customers. This means additional income and better living conditions for Arzuman.

loans.use: to pay for new wheels for his trucks.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married. She has five grown children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Nilda has engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She personally tends to the cleaning, bathing and feeding of the domestic animals. Her interest in doing this business has kept her going for four years. Every month, she earns PHP 10,000 from her business undertakings.

Earlier this year, Nilda joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. On her 1st loan transaction, she has requested PHP 30,000 from the cooperative to purchase breeding livestock to raise and later sell. By having all of these animals grown, Nilda hopes to sell them at a higher price to increase her income generated.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock to raise.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Ii-El Tambo Group

texts.es: LA SRA RENEE ULDA  D.  42 AÑOS D. EDAD ,CONVIVIENTE CON 02 HIJOS   D. 17 Y 15 AÑOS D. EDAD  ,ES SOCIA D. LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL CRISTO REY II   ,JUNTAMENTE CON SUS SIETE  COMPAÑEROS QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA  COMUNAL  PROMETEN SEGUIR TRABAJANDO HONESTAMENTE  Y SER  PUNTUALES  COMO LO HAN ESTADO TRABAJANDO EN LOS ANTERIORES CICLOS .LA SRA  RENNE SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA D. COMIDA  QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA    EN LA ESQUINA DEL PARQUE JUSTICIA ,PAZ Y VIDA  .LA  SRA RENNE SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER  COMPRAR  UNA REFRIGERADORA , ASI PODER TENER EN BUEN ESTADO LOS INSUMOS. LA SRA RENNE QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO  PODER TENER UN LOCAL MAS  EN EL CENTRO D. HUANCAYO  PARA ASI POD. OBTENER MAS INGRESOS .LA SRA RENEE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  AL CENTRO ,A LADO IZQUIERDO D. LA SRA QUE VISTE UN POLO COLOR MORADO Y UN CHALECO  COLOR CREMA,LLEVA EN BRAZOS A SU NIÑO  .LA SRA RENNE VISTE UNA CASACA COLOR BLANCO,UN POLO COLOR CELESTE Y BUZO COLOR NEGRO
texts.en: 42 year old Renee lives with her 2 children, who are 17 and 15 years old. She is a member of the community bank "Cristo Rey II", along with her 7 companions. They all promise to keep working honestly and to be punctual, which is the way they have worked in previous loan cycles. Renee works selling food, and she has a stall in the corner of the park called "Justicia, Paz, y Vida". Renee is requesting this loan to be able to buy a refrigerator so that she can keep her supplies in good condition. In the future, Renee would like to have a stall more in the center of Huancayo so that she could have better profits. Renee is in the center of the photo, on the left siD. of the woman who is wearing a purple shirt and a cream colored vest, with a baby in her arms. Renee is wearing a white jacket, a sky blue shirt, and black pants.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ninoska Isabel

texts.es:
Ninoska, de 41 años de edad, es originaria de San Carlos municipio de Rio San Juan departamento de Nicaragua pero vive en la ciudad de Granada, esta casada, madre de 2 hijos, ella es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa. Inicio con este negocio cuando tenía 39 años de edad,  comenzó con muy poco inventario, con el tiempo fue incrementando su mercadería poco a poco esta logra establecerla con los productos comestibles básicos que sus clientes requieren y son de consumo cotidiano. 
Ella realizo el crédito para invertir en compra de productos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo, leche, frutas, verduras, jabones de limpieza. Esto le ayudara a mantener surtida su pulpería de mercadería que le es muy solicitada por sus clientes, quiere invertir es otros productos para variar y hacer mas clientes, poder incrementar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos. Una de sus metas es convertir su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Ninoska is 41 years old. She is originally from San Carlos a municipality in the department of Rio San Juan in Nicaragua but lives in the city of Granada. She is married and has 2 children. She is a storekeeper and has a small grocery store at home. She started this business when she was 39 years old. She started out with very little inventory but with time she increased her merchandise little by little. She managed to establish her business with basic food products that her customers want and are used every day. 

She needed the loan to invest in the purchase of products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, fruit, vegetables and cleaning soap. This will help her keep her grocery store stocked with products her customers want. She wants to invest in other products to provide variety and attract more customers, increase her sales and improve her income. One of her goals is to convert her small grocery store into a distribution centre for food.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, vegetables and cleaning soap.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Larry has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green & yellow bananas to sell.

Larry has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Andranik

texts.ru:
Андранику 36 лет, он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Сьюникского региона, вместе со своей женой и тремя детьми. Дочери Андраника посещают школу, а сын – детский сад. 
Андраник занимается сельским хозяйством и параллельно торговлей продуктов и хозяйственных товаров. У него в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 2 теленка и 20 кур. А продовольственными и хозяйственными товарами он торгует уже 10 лет в небольшом вагончике, который находится в непосредственной близости от его дома. В торговле ему помогает жена. И благодаря своему бизнесу и ферме они содержат свою семью. 
Андранику необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для увеличения ассортимента своего вагона-магазинчика, а именно для приобретения партии макаронных изделий, консервированных продуктов, подсолнечного масла, а также большой партии стиральных порошков и чистящих средств. 
Будущую прибыль Андраник намерен использовать для строительства нового магазинчика для своей торговли.
texts.en: Andranik is 36 years old.  He lives in the Tsovagyugh village in the Syunik region together with his wife and three children.  Andranik's daughters attend a school, and son goes to kindergarten.  Andranik is involved in agriculture and, parallel to that, sales of products and household goods.  His farm includes 3 cows, 2 calves and 20 chickens.  He has been selling food products and household goods for 10 years at a small wagon, which is located in close proximity to his home.  His wife helps him with the sales.  Thanks to their business and farm, they can support their family.  Andranik needs a loan in the sum of 800,000 dram to expand the assortment of his wagon-store, especially to buy an inventory of pasta, canned goods, sunflower oil and also a large inventory of laundry detergents and cleaning supplies.  Andranik plans to use the future profit to build a new store for his retail business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and household goods for his business

loans.name: Mame Fatimata

texts.fr: C’est une femme  divorcée  de 40 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur  du commerce de produits cosmétiques et alimentaires.  Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 fr prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et de denrées alimentaires destinés a la vente. Elle veut rentabiliser son activité de commerce et maximiser ses bénéfices car elle doit se prendre en charge dans ses besoins quotidiens et vitaux.
texts.en: This is a divorced woman who is 40 years old and lives in Senegal. She sells cosmetics and groceries. She has been a shareholder/member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) since August 2011. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy cosmetics and groceries which she plans to sell on. She would like to make her business profitable and maximise her earnings so that she can provide for her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and groceries for resale

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is composed of four hardworking women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies for resale and will help Grace to generate greater profits and solve domestic problems. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children and buy a cow. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has improved Grace's future prospects by helping her to learn how to manage her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 30-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her family's goals are to provide a better education for the children and to improve the family's living conditions, such as by constructing a good house.

Monica owns a retail shop dealing in beer, sodas, and sugar. She is faced with the problem of insufficient capital to expand her business. The purpose of the loan she has requested is to buy more beer, sodas, and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a school, taking children from lower classes to upper classes. Her customers are children of the neighboring community members. She dreams of expanding her school to a polytechnic school in the future.

With the loan of 26,100 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a mabati (iron sheeting) for roofing of the classrooms. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a mabati (iron sheeting) for roofing of the classrooms.

loans.name: Busy Fingers Group

texts.en:
Ndaizivei, age 35, sells suits, costumes, jewelry, and shirts. She operates her business from her home and has been engaged in her business for three years. The challenge she faces is that sometimes business is slow and some of her debtors fail to pay on time. She is also involved in group activities with her lending group, whose members save and lend each other money. She is married and has two children, ages three and eight. Her husband is a teacher at a local school.
 
In the next five years, she wants to open a boutique in town. With the proceeds expected to result from the loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and suits to offer for sale

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela, de 29 años convive con Rusbel de 33 años; viven en casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija Deni de 02 años, a quien desean darle lo mejor para el futuro. Mayela, es una mujer con muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida y darle un buen futuro a su hija. La labor que realiza Mayela, es comprar terrenos a un precio menor, para luego venderlas a un precio que pueda solventar los gastos de su familia; hace 02 años que realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de su pareja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder llevarse muy bien con la gente a quienes compra y vende sus terrenos y considera que lo más difícil es no poder comprarse un terreno propio ya que desea dar lo mejor a su pequeña. Mayela con el préstamo solicitado desea comprar un terreno y luego venderlo para el sustento de su hogar. Este es su préstamo número 05 con MFP, de la misma forma espera su colaboración para continuar con su objetivo. Así mismo agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas que la apoyan. Con lo 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá seguir trabajando en la actividad a la que realiza comprar un terreno y luego venderlo para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mayela is 29 years old and lives with her partner Rusbel who is 33.  They live in a rental house together with their young daughter Deni who is 2 years old.  They love their daughter and would like to provide her with the best for her future.

Mayela is a woman who has a great desire to do well in life and provide her daughter with a good future.  Her business is buying plots of land at low prices and then selling them at a price which can cover her family's expenses.  She has been working in this business for two years with the help of her partner.  What Mayela most likes about her work is being able to get on really well with the people from whom she buys and those to whom she sells her plots of land and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be not being able to buy a plot of land of her own as she would like to give her little one the best in life.  Mayela would like to use the loan she has requested to buy a plot of land and then sell it so that she can provide for her household. 

This will be Mayela's fifth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She is grateful for her community bank and the fact that she works with people who support her.  She will use her 3,000 soles to continue working in her business, buying a plot of land and then selling it to provide for her household.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un señor de 56 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace 3 años Edwin se dedica a una porqueriza. Desde que inició este proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Edwin es solicitar un préstamo por ¢400,000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar cerdos y alimento, que necesita para su proyecto de porcicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  

Edwin forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 56-year-old man who lives with his family in a rural community of Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón.  Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers to the south of the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica.  It is 850 meters above sea level.  There they grow vegetables and coffee, and also do other work such as raising cattle and pigs for fattening.  There are also other projects of organic agriculture and hydroponic vegetables.  In addition to agriculture, in the community there are auto repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (coffee bars), and a furniture store.

Edwin has worked in a pigsty for three years.  Since he began this project the results have been good because he has had great success in the community, and the income he has generated has helped him get his family ahead.

What Edwin wants now is to request a loan of 400,00 CRC to buy pigs and feed, which he needs for his pig-raising project.  With this he hopes that his small business grows and comes to generate more income to improve his living conditions.

Edwin is part of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  As a member it has received a micro-loan that allowed them to grow as small business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Luckystar Group

texts.en: This is Mary. She is 51 years old, married with seven children, and lives in the “city of progress” called Gweru in Zimbabwe and is into the poultry and retail business of selling clothes and blankets. Three of her children still attend school. Mary has one dependent living with her who also still attends school. She has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy chicks, chicken feed, blankets for her poultry project and flea market business. With the income from this loan she will be able to improve her business performance and return a bit more income for investment into other ventures . She says the challenges faced in her business are bad debtors who sometimes fail to make payments for the items bought on credit. She is planning to invest into more businesses that might benefit her community by reducing poverty .

loans.use: To buy chicken, chicken feed, blankets and comforters for flea markets.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a 34-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Charlita runs a fish-selling business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for eleven years, and each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from it. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Charlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Charlita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Los Semilleros De Huepil Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Semilleros de Huepil” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de ensaladas, venta de joyas, venta de lencería, reparación de calzado, confección de ropa, peluquería, venta de alimentos congelados, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Jessica delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, en el lugar del medio, viste un vestido estampado con diferentes colores negro, amarillo, verde, fucsia, Calipso, usa su cabello suelto con flequillo y es de color caoba.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva para dama. Desde hace un año aproximadamente.
Su mercadería la compra por internet o la compra directamente en el barrio Patronato, comprando modelos exclusivos.
Su horario de trabajo es flexible y sus clientes son conocidos y cercanos a su casa.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para dama, específicamente blusas.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es tener una boutique en la cual pueda ofrecer su mercadería de una manera más atractiva y cómoda para atraer más clientela.
Jessica vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 13, 5 y 2 años de edad, uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es estudiar una carrera con alguna especialidad en idiomas.
Ella además está muy contenta, motivada y agradecida en participar de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y aprender nuevas técnicas para mejorar la contabilidad de su negocio. Comenta que el grupo es muy comprometido y que las reuniones son muy amenas. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Los Semilleros de Huepil, is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including salad preparation, jewelry sales, lingerie sales, shoe repair, tailoring, hairdressing, and frozen food sales, among other businesses.  All of them are in the city of Chillán.

Jessica is the delegate of the communal bank group.  In the photo she is in the middle of the front row, wearing a Calypso dress printed with different colors, black, yellow, green, fuchsia.  She wears her mahogany-colored hair loose with bangs.

She has worked selling new clothing for women for approximately a year.  She buys her merchandise on the Internet or directly in her Patronato neighborhood, buying exclusive styles.  Her work schedule is flexible and her customers are acquaintances and close to her house.

With the loan she will buy women's clothing, specifically blouses.

One of her goals for her business is to have a boutique in which she can offer her merchandise in a more attractive and comfortable way, to attract more customers.

Jessica lives with her husband and three children, ages 13, 5, and 2.  One of her personal dreams is to study some field with a specialization in languages.

In addition, she is very happy, motivated, and grateful to participate in Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business and learn new techniques to improve the accounting in her business.  She comments that the group is very committed and the meetings enjoyable.

Chillán is a village in the south-central part of Chile. The name means "Chair of the Sun" in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuche.  Chillán is known as the "Birthplace of the Country" or "Land of the Artists" because in this region many of the great figures of Chilean history were born, such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, specifically blouses.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
I prepare natural meals and refreshments. I’ve had my business for five years, and it’s been going well. My clients choose me for my yummy burritas I prepare (tortilla with meat, fried beans, and butter). In the mornings is when I sell the most, because I deliver my meals to offices. During weekends, I sell beauty products such as cosmetics and lotions. This provides me with an extra income that helps me cover my children’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase tortillas, chicken, sausage, butter, cheese, beans, fruits, and others.

Mi actividad es la elaboracion de alimentos y refrescos naturales, tengo cinco años de tener mi negocio y me ha ido bien. Mis clientes me prefieren por las ricas burritas (tortilla con carne, frijolitos fritos y mantequilla) que preparo, por la mañana es cuando mas vendo, ya que entrego mi comida en oficinas, los fines de semana vendo productos de belleza como cosmeticos, lociones, cremas esto me genera un ingreso extra que bastante me ayuda con los gastos de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de tortillas, pollo, chorizo, mantequilla, queso, frijoles, frutas y otros

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells a local beverage in the community. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs and is a member of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan of $500 to expand her business and sell to school children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Lorenzo has a grocery store where he also sells other basic necessities, in a business area and on a main street. He began his business with some money that his wife sent him from abroad, where she has been for three years now.

Loan Use

Don Lorenzo will use this loan to purchase more merchandise on wholesale and continue to invest in his store so that he can improve it and attract more customers.

Personal Information

Don Lorenzo is 45 and has three children who all go to school. He lives in a cement-built home. He has the firm conviction that with the improvements he will make in his store, he will bring in more customers. With the increase in customers, he will be able to better assure the future of his family and he will be able to bring his wife home to live with them again.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Descripción del Negocio

Don Lorenzo tiene una tienda donde vende víveres y artículos de primera necesidad en un sector muy comercia y en calle principal. Este negocio lo empezó con un dinero que le envío su esposa que está en el exterior hace tres años. /p>

Uso del Préstamo

Don Lorenzo usará el préstamo para comprar más mercadería al por mayor y así poder seguir realizando inversiones en el negocio y pronto incrementarlo de tal manera que pueda tener más clientes

Información Personal

Él tiene 45 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento. Lorenzo tiene la firme convicción que con las mejorar que haga en su negocio su clientela aumentara y así podrá asegurar el futuro de su familia y en un momento dado su esposa pueda regresar para estar juntos nuevamente

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and other products.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and supports a family of four children. All the children are of school-going age. The eldest -also the only girl- is in Grade 7. All the rest are boys and two of them are enrolled in Grade 5 while the youngest is in Grade 3.

Alex rents a small room in the city suburbs of Kampala where he stays with one of the boys. The rest of the children stay in the village with their mother because the cost of living in Kampala is too high for the family. Alex is employed in the transport business and rides a motorcycle ferrying passengers to different destinations. This has been his source of livelihood for the past few years.

Alex now wants to acquire a motorcycle of his own, which will help him increase his daily income, meet the children's school fees requirements and provide for their other basic living expenses. He is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a new motorcycle. He will be able to repay the loan in a period of 7months

loans.use: Puchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Chahina

texts.en: Chahina is a single woman living in the Bekaa and owns a grocery shop. The store is her only source of income. Chahina is an entrepreneur who takes business initiatives to ensure her business's survival. Chahina is planning to develop her grocery store and therefore needs to purchase merchandise to expand her line of products. This is the first time Chahina has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mrs. Vat C., 60, works as a tailor, earning around $1.50 each day. Her husband, 63, makes items used in religious rituals, such as incense, golden coconuts, and decorated banana trees. He sells them in the market, making about $3.50 per day. They have six children. One lives at home and is employed in a garment factory, making about $70 per month.  The others are married and live in their own homes. She is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motor-bike for one of her children, who wants to operate a motor-taxi business. In this way, he will earn additional money to supplement his family’s income. Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike so that her son can start a taxi business.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. is a married man with one son. He sells new and used clothing in Chinandega city. He began this business 7 years ago, and has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years. He says he began this business when he was without work for a while, and with these sales he could take care of his son.

Since working with Ceprodel for three years, he says he feels good about the previous loans as they have been very timely and accessed easily, and have enabled him to purchase merchandise that he didn’t have.

This business is located near the main bus station in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. es un señor casado y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en la ciudad de Chinandega. Lo comienza hace siete años, tiene de trabajar con CEPRODEL tres años, dice que este negocio lo emprendió cuando queda sin trabajo por una temporada, y que de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos.

Este señor, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le han servido para compra de mercadería que no la tenia en existencia.

Actualmente este negocio está ubicado cerca de la estación principal de buses en Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea N., age 58, is a housewife. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice and vegetables, making on average around $1.50 each day. She has seven children. Two of them are employed by a garment factory, three are married and live separately, and the rest are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Santos Elena, 45, studied through high school. She now has three children, two of whom still live with her. She lives in the Human Victor Raul settlement in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She raises farm animals such as ducks and chickens and fattens them for sale in the nearby Santa Rosa market. Sometimes she gets larger orders for holidays such as Mother's Day, Christmas, national holidays, etc. In addition to that, she works as a street vendor, buying carnations and roses from a wholesaler in the La Hermelinda market and selling them in other local markets, and grows pineapples and avocados on a small piece of land she inherited in the "distrito" of Poroto that she harvests approximately every three months and also sells.

Thanks to some neighbors, she joined the Mujeres del Milenium ("Women of the Millenium") community bank where she received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100). With the money, she bought feed for her animals. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy eight sacks of processed feed, 30 dozen roses and 30 dozen carnations. Santos Elena dream of buying a stand in the market and setting up a flower shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Santos Elena A. M. tiene 45 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene tres hijos en total pero sólo dos dependen de ella. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Su negocio consiste en la crianza de animales menores tales como patos, pollos y gallinas, a los cuales engorda para venderlos en el mercado “Santa Rosa” ubicado en el distrito en el que vive. A veces le hacen pedidos al por mayor en fechas especiales como día de la madre, navidad, fiestas patrias, etc., además en el mercado “La Hermelinda” compra variedad de flores, claveles y rosas al por mayor para volver a vender en condición de ambulante por distintos mercados de la ciudad. En un pequeño terreno que heredó en el distrito de Poroto ha sembrado algunas plantas como piñas y paltas que cosecha cada tres meses aproximadamente, productos que también trae a vender en los mercados.

Gracias a unas vecinas ingresó al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Milenium”, lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300, con este dinero compró el alimento para sus animales: concentrado y maíz. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará ocho sacos de concentrado, 30 docenas de rosas y 30 docenas de claveles. La señora Elena sueña con comprar un puesto en el mercado e implementar una florería.

loans.use: Buy animal feed for livestock business and flowers for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is married with 5 children, and she is 38 years old. She sells foodstuffs like beans, vegetable oil, etc. She has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago Ofir V. Correa lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Antolina and his two children.

Many years ago, Santiago started working in a bookstore called Cassol, where he gained experience in the field. Tired of being an employee, he decided to open his own bookstore in the shopping center of Ciudad del Este. Santiago sells articles used in writing such as paper, pens, quills, inkstands, pencils, and blank books. It is worth mentioning that the store is located in a strategic place, because Ciudad del Este is a commercial city. Usually Paraguayans go to Ciudad del Este only to buy things; from electronic devices to clothes.

Besides the bookstore, Santiago owns a grocery store. Santiago’s wife is the one responsible for the “Despensa” (grocery store). Antolina stays the entire day in the Despensa selling products such as milk, drinks, cigarettes, pasta, etc. The Despensas in Paraguay could be considered as mini supermarkets.

The money provided by this loan is intended to be used for the purchase of paper and other things for Santiago’s bookstore. There is a huge demand for paper and without this loan the increasing demand would not be satisfied.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, pens and books

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
Wara D. is 32 years old and married with three children. She started her grocery store three years ago and with her previous loan from SMT she increased her stock and has attracted many customers.

Wara would like to expand her business to generate more income to improve her family's life. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3,000,000 ($US1,050).

loans.use: To purchase various groceries for her store.

loans.name: Dialia

texts.fr:
Miss Dialia B. is 32 years old and has been living with her brothers, sisters, and daughter at her late father's home since her divorce in Sanoubougou I, a district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali)

After having run several business activities since her youth, she decided 15 years ago to specialize in the sale of clothing for children. To obtain supplementary financial resourrces in order to meet the needs of a constantly increasing clientele, she decided to take part in the program by asking for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan.

She has been making voluntary deposits at Soro Yiriwaso for about 2 and a half years. With this loan, she intends to buy 60 outfits (pants and shirt made of the same cloth), 28 bedcovers, 5 dozen containers of powder for children's skin, and 5 dozen containers of children's perfume in Cotonou and in Lomé (Republics of Benin and Togo, respectively, in West Africa). To reach Lomé and Cotonou, she rents a bus for 40,000 FCFA, and arranges her lodging and daily food. She re-sells her merchandise for cash in her shop located hear the Sikasso bus station. With this loan, she intends to a realize a monthly profit of 600,000 FCFA, which will allow her to contribute to the family's expenses, repay the interest on her loan, and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Dialia B. a 32 ans , et vit avec ses frères , ses soeurs, et sa fille chez son feu père depuis son divorce à Sanoubougou I, un quartier de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus dès son jeune age, elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente d’habits pour enfants depuis maintenant 15 ans. Pour obtenir des ressources financières supplémentaires afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle décida d’intègrer le Programme en demandant un prêt à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel .

Elle effectue des depots d’épargne volontaire à Soro Yiriwaso depuis environ deux 2 ans et demi . Avec ce prêt, elle compte achéter 60 complets (pantalon et chemise de meme tissu ), 28 couvres lits, 5 douzaines de poudre de peau pour enfant et 5 douzaines de parfum pour enfant à Cotonou et à Lomé (Républiques du Benin et de Togo en Afrique de l’Ouest). Pour se rendre à Lomé et à Cotonou, elle emprunte des bus pour 40.000 FCFA, assure son hebergement et sa nourriture quotidiennement. Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant dans sa boutique située à la gare routière de Sikasso. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 600 000 FCFA qui lui permettrons de contribuer aux charges familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and others

loans.name: Elena De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
The group Elena de la Cruz comes from a beautiful town on the shores of Lake Atitlan called Santa Cruz la Laguna. The residents of Santa Cruz have the good fortune of waking up each day and experiencing the beauty of the lake at first sight. This town is divided between the indigenous residents, who live their lives in a very traditional way, and a group of expatriates who are currently investing a great deal in the tourism industry.

The women of Santa Cruz used to live in absolute poverty and without much hope of getting ahead, until a few years ago when “Gringa Lil” began to organize women together to request loans from microfinance institutions. Thanks to the efforts of this industry the town began to grow. This is how the Friendship Bridge began operations in Santa Cruz.

All of the women work with textiles. Half of the group work as weavers of huipiles (typical blouses) and rebosos (scarves), while the other half work as embroiderers.
