They embroider the huipiles or beautiful colorful blouses. They reinvest their profits in the purchase of threads to weave or embroider their fabrics.

The Elenas de la Cruz sell their products in the market of their town. They also sell in neighboring towns. The interesting thing is that from Santa Cruz to other potential markets like Jaibalito and Tzununa, one can only reach them by boat. The ladies load their baskets with merchandise and then proceed to carry the baskets on their heads to the boats which carry them to neighboring towns.

This group of women would like to continue investing in their businesses, because they want their businesses to grow in order to continue helping their families. They dream that their children will be able to continue going to school all the way to graduation. You can help them reach their dreams. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Elena de la Cruz proviene de un bello pueblo a las orillas del lago Atitlán llamado Santa Cruz la laguna. Los pobladores de Santa Cruz tienen la fortuna de poder levantarse todos los días y experimentar la belleza del lago a primera vista. Este pueblo está dividido entre los pobladores indígenas, los cuales viven sus vidas de una manera muy tradicionales y un grupo de expatriados que actualmente están invirtiendo mucho en la industria del turismo.

Las mujeres de Santa Cruz vivían en la pobreza absoluta y sin mucha esperanza de salir adelante, hasta que hace unos cuantos años la “gringa Lil” empezó a juntar a mujeres para que solicitaran préstamos a las instituciones de microfinanzas. Gracias a este esfuerzo esta industria empezó a crecer en este bello pueblo. Así fue como The Friendship Bridge empezó operaciones en Santa Cruz.

Todas las mujeres trabajan en el área textil. La mitad del grupo trabaja como tejedoras de huipiles (blusas típicas) y rebosos (pañuelos), mientras que la otra mitad trabaja como bordadoras. Ellas bordan los huipiles o bellas blusas de colores. Ellas invierten su crédito en la compra de hilos para tejer o bordar sus tejidos.

Las Elenas de la Cruz venden sus productos en el mercado de su pueblo. Ellas, también venden sus productos en los pueblos aledaños. Lo interesante es que de Santa Cruz a los otros mercados potenciales como Jaibalito y Tzununa solo se puede llegar por lancha. Las señoras arman sus canastos con mercadería y proceden a cargar los canastos en sus cabezas hasta las lanchas las cuales la llevan hasta los mercados de los pueblos aledaños.

Este grupo de señoras quieren seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios porque ellas quieren que sus negocios puedan seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a sus familias. Ellas sueñas con que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando hasta terminar una carrera. Ustedes pueden lograr que ellas cumplan con sus sueños, ¡apóyenlas!

loans.use:
The purchase of threads to weave or embroider their textiles.

Ellas invierten su crédito en la compra de hilos para tejer o bordar sus tejidos.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 43 years old and has been working as a fisherman since 1993 at Tunle Sap Lake. He earns around 13,200 Riel (US $3.30) per day. His wife, Mrs. Nhem Touch, is 43 years old and earns around 8,300 Riel (US $2.00) a day working as a farmer. They have four children, one of whom works in his father's business, earning about 12,000 Riel (US $3.00) per day. The family lives in Anglung Samnor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. Heng wants to expand his business by purchasing more fishing tools but he lacks the capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
MIGUEL N. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.
EL SEÑOR MIGUEL LABORA PARA UNA EMPRESA EN EL AREA DE MANTENIMIENTO  SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GLORIA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA EN  UNA CASA DONDE YA TIENE MUCHOS AÑOS, JUNTOS COMO UN MATRIMONIO UNIDO CON AMOR Y POR LA FUERZA DE SALIR ADELANTE ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR LA COCINA DE  SU CASA, YA QUE ES MUY PEQUEÑA Y MEDIANTE ESTA REMODELACION ELLOS PODRAN ESTAR MAS COMODOS Y ASI EN UN FUTURO CERCANO PODER TENER UN HOGAR MAS AMPLIO.
texts.en:
MIGUEL N. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Señor Miguel works for a maintenance business. His wife, Señora Gloria, works as a domestic employee in a home where she has been for many years. Together, in a marriage united by love and by the force of improving their lives, they are asking for this loan in order to enlarge the kitchen of their house. The existing one is extremely small and after this remodelling work, they would be more comfortable and so in the near future they would be able to have a larger home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the kitchen in their home

loans.name: Fatou Niakassy

texts.fr: Fatou Niakassy S., 55 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes Mpack depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du sel, du nététou, de l’huile de palme, du miel, du piment et des diakhato et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fatou Niakassy S., 55, married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Ressortissantes Mpack for 2 years. She wants a loan to buy salt, nététou (an edible paste made from tree leaves), palm oil, honey, hot peppers, etc. for re-sale. Her income permits her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling vegetables and foodstuffs

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila was born in 1960 and lives in the Absheron region of Azerbaijan. She is married and has two children. Thirteen years ago she started a business selling groceries and household goods. She is applying for a $1,200 loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice, 29 years old, married to a civil engineer and the mother of two children, both attending school, is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rejoice hopes that the extra profits accruing from the loan will allow her to further expand the business in the near future.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beer for sale.

loans.name: Lalotoa

texts.en:
Lalotoa M., 43, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lalotoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used to buy fishing gear for her husband; his business goes together with her plantation. Her husband is a very good fisherman who always goes fishing and can earn money from it.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working a lathe for thirty years. He has requested a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid his loans on time.

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. Ali decided to start his business because he was in need of cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny T. is a 31 year old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she earns a living distilling Khmer wine for sale, as well as raising pigs. To help with the family's food needs, her husband sells firewood by cutting it down from the forest. They have two children who are teenagers and in school. Ny T. hopes to improve her business, because it is very profitable for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise. The remainder of the loan will used for her husband's business operation.

loans.use: To buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas I. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks.  Dorcas lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Bottul

texts.en:
Bottul Z. currently sells beans, cooking oil, mangoes, etc. and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Bottul is 41 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez y Elena Patricia Mallorquín G..

 El grupo solidario Camino a la Luz, es originario del municipio de Tisma perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la elaboración y venta de cajetas y sacan el producto al mercado.

Las cuatro miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Rosa del Carmen O. H.,  elabora y vende cajetas y comida en la zona franca cercana, ella ofrece a las personas que trabajan en la empresa, tiene clientes fijos. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad.
Doña Blanca Azucena G., tiene una mini pulpería en su casa donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad como : arroz, frijoles, queso, pan, gaseosas, etc., ella es madres soltera con tres hijos pequeños que ella mantiene, van a clase a la escuela mas cercana del barrio.
Doña María Auxiliadora C.  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde ofrece refrescos, helados, hielo, gaseosas, etc. Viva sola con su hijo de 18 años quien ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Elena Patricia Mallorquín G., elabora cajetas, arroz con leche, atoles y otros postres, ella los ofrece ambulante en el municipio de Tisma y entrega en el mercado a algunos clientes que le compran al por mayor Tiene un hijo pequeño de un año, ella cuida a su hijo y elabora los dulces y sale a venderlos, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa él trabaja en la agricultura en los sembradíos de tomate.Doña Elena sueña con mejorar su casita que es bien humilde e insegura para el invierno, esto ahora que su hijo es pequeño. Anima a las integrantes del grupo para que los pagos sean puntuales y así tener siempre derecho al crédito.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez, and Elena Patricia Mallorquín G.. The group "Camino a la Luz" is originally from the Tisma area in the city of Masaya. The group creates and sells sweet caramels called "cajetas" and brings the product to to the market. The four group members have a high level of trust among them. They are neighbors and they have come together to purchase products to get a better price. Rosa del Carmen O. H. makes and sells "cajetas" and food in the "zona franca" (the free port) nearby. She offers her products to the people who work there, and she has regular clients. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and works as a taxi driver. She cares for her small child and works. Blanca Azucena G. has a small general store in her home, where she offers to her customers common products such as: rice, beans, cheese, bread, soft drinks, etc. She is a single mother with three small children whom she cares for. The go to the closest school in the neighborhood. María Auxiliadora C. has a small business in her home where she sells snacks, ice creams, ice, soft drinks, etc. She lives alone with her 18 year-old son who works and helps out with her expenses. Elena Patricia Mallorquín G. makes "cajetas," rice pudding, and atole (a kind of thick drink made with corn flour) and other deserts. She offers these products door-to-door in the Tisma area and delivers them to several wholesale clients in the market. She has one small son, who is one year old. She cares for him, makes her sweets and sells them, while her husband helps with the expenses by working in agriculture planting tomatoes. Elena dreams of improving her small home which is very humble, and securing her home for the winter, all while her son is young. She motivates the members of the group to be punctual with their payments so they can have always have access to these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make cajetas (caramels) and sweets like: rice, sugar, milks, tamarind, cacao, and to be able to offer a variety of sweets to customers

loans.name: Sendiwanyo Oliver ‘S Group

texts.en:
Oliver is the leader of a loan group with 5 members. She is 43-years old and married with three children between 14 and 20 of age. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-room house where she lives with five people. There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Oliver works seven days a week selling charcoal from her home in Mengo MacKay She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells retail and wholesale. Wholesalers deliver the charcoal to her home and don't charge a transport cost. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity and school fees. She has been in this business for two years, and her main challenges are the increasing prices of charcoal and rent charges. Oliver has been with MCDT for over three years and has worked with the same group mates during that time. She is servicing her fifth loan. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and hopes to own her own business premises.

.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Kara Bet

texts.en:
Kara Bet is 50 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car repairer for 24 years. Kara Bet decided on this line of work because of his experience, and when he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. His customers are friends and neighbors, and his business is successful because he does his work well.

Kara Bet has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase spare parts. This is Kara Bet's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him to improve his garage.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Yesa

texts.en: V. is forty-three years old and married with two children. V. is a cosmetician, who sells cosmetics and also does make-up for individuals for special events. She has been in this business for four years. Due to an increase in demand, she needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 56 years old. She is married and has two children. One is in schooling and one is working. Her husband has been very supportive in taking care of the children. Theresa works very hard and approaches her business with commitment. For two years, she has been trading in gari sales. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the carbohydrate supplements. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retails to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy gari in bulk quantities to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of gari.

loans.name: Regina Bayiyana‘S Group

texts.en:
Regina is the leader of a five-member group. She is 47 years old and widowed with six children aged between 20 and 32 years. Only one child goes to school. Regina resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with two people. She also takes care of ten additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Regina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She lives in Bwaise Katogo zone selling charcoal, water and chickens at her rented shop in Bwaise, one of the Kampala suburbs, and has been in this business for the last twenty-five years. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people, excluding children. She works seven days a week, selling mainly on retail. She incurs extra transportation costs to and from shopping or work and does her shopping once a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both home and business premises. 

Regina has been with MCDT for over eleven years and is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Regina is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture here are Mrs. Khoeun S. and her husband. Khoeun S. is a 27-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province. She is married to Mr. Moa Tit, age 26, who works with her in the farming business. He also takes time to find firewood in the forest for income.

This couple currently owns a medium-sized stall that they use for raising pigs and cows. During the coming farming season when the heavy rains immediately begin falling down, that is the best time for Khoeun S. to begin growing her crops. Due to their lack of capital, Khoeun S. would like a loan of US$ 1200 from Kiva’s partner HKL. She will be using her loan to buy two cows in order to alleviate her hard labor on the farm and to buy fertilizer and seed for planting. In the future, she proposes to breed her cows for their young.

loans.use: To buy two cows in order to alleviate her hard labor on the farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader, trading in smoked fish. Mary procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Maria de los Ángeles A. Hernández  , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el barrio El rodeo , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción  , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar   , ellos tienen un hijo de dos añitos a  cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Maria desde hace 3 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, cuando las ventas están bajas es cuando pierde en su inversión es por eso con el financiamiento aumentara su inversión en la compra de frutas y verduras para atraer la captación de nuevos clientes, su anhelo de doña Maria  sueña con poder comprar un camión para poder transportar sus productos a distintos departamentos y poder obtener mejores ganancia ya que llevaría productos a vender y traería mercadería la cual se compra mas barata. Da las gracias a la institución por este financiamiento.

loans.use: Comprara verduras y frutas en variedad

loans.name: Unity Family Group

texts.en:
This is Mabinty C., Posseh K., Sayo K., Cyril I. K. and Fatu C., and they have called their group Unity Family. This is the first loan this group is accessing from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses in size and quality. Consequently, their sales and profit margins will improve – they will then be able to better support their school-aged children in terms of food, clothes, school fees and other school-related charges.

Mabinty C. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Mabinty was born in Magbontho, near Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 48 years old, and married with seven children who attend primary or secondary school. Mabinty sells palm oil, the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone, and has been in this business for more than 25 years. With this loan, she will buy more palm oil, rice and groundnuts/peanuts.

(Attached on the left is a group member who was not present for the group photograph.)

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and groundnuts/peanuts

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Barrio San Martín, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar de ganado ovino  para engorde, ya que también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar en su hogar.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Faustina is a member of the communal bank “Vírgen del Rosario” located in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 55 years old, is a widow, and has three kids. She lives in the San Martín neighborhood and she has completed primary school (6th grade). Faustina has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for PEN 300, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 500, which will allow her to buy sheep, fatten them up, then resell them. She already raises cows. Faustina's biggest wish is to keep working to help out her family. She loves to save and to have conversations.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Habiles (Skillful Women).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Josefina lives in a rural community in the province of Puerto Plata with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 6).  They have unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

Josefina sells various clothing items to those in her community and the surrounding communities.  She has over 9 years of experience with this business. She has successfully repaid three loans with Esperanza.  She plans to use this fourth loan to purchase more items to sell including shoes, accessories and clothing. Her goal is to be able to have a wide variety of inventory to meet all of her clients' needs. She has been able to use the loans to invest in her business and help it to grow.  Josefina hopes to continue to improve her family's living conditions by growing her business.  She thanks you for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: Shoes, accessories and clothes

loans.name: Sarah Lyn

texts.en:
Sarah Lyn B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Sarah Lyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah Lyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sarah Lyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sarah Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah Lyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarah Lyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Olinda

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive junto a su hijo de dos años de edad y una tía en el anexo Los Alamos, en el caserío La Colorada, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad por mantener a su hijo hizo que empezara a comercializar animales. Usualmente va a venderlos dos veces por semana a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Eventualmente también los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio, nos cuenta que algunos  vecinos le han ofrecido animales en venta y quiere comprarlos para negociarlos  pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante y sacar adelante a su hijo. Ella es una madre luchadora y que dia a dia da todo de sí para lograr sus metas. En la fotografía aparece junto a un caballo que pronto ofrecerá en venta.
texts.en:
María is 27, is a single mother, and lives with her 2-year-old son and her aunt in Los Alamos in a town called La Colorada in the district of Mórrope, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to support her son made her start selling animals. Usually she goes to sell them twice a week in the city of Chiclayo. She also sometimes sells to businesspeople who frequent the area. She hopes to expand her business. She tells us that some neighbors have offered to sell her animals, and she wants to buy them, but she doesn't have enough capital to do this. This is why she thinks it's necessary to request her first loan for 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Her biggest wish is to keep working to get ahead and to take good care of her son. She is a hard-working mother who gives all of herself day after day to accomplish her goals. In the picture she appears with a horse that she will soon offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 62 años, es madre soltera; vive con su hija, quien tiene una hermosa pequeña y también está a cargo a  su madre.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, lo cuales vende sólo a pedido a través de catálogos, dejándolos al crédito o al contado.
Adicionalmente, cuenta con un motocarro, para el que contrata a chofer quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y le entrega a ella las ganancias diarias.
A María le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y sobre todo porque se mantiene activa. 
Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda de zapatos y ropa.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas muy responsables y sobre todo, muy comunicativos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y tenerlos mejor protegidos.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and she’s a single mom. She lives with her daughter, who has a beautiful little girl and she’s also supporting her mother. She began selling beauty products ten years ago. She only sells them through catalog upon request, in cash or credit. She also owns a motorcar, for which she hired a person who works as a public transport driver and gives her all the daily earnings. María enjoys her work very much because she can meet a lot of people and maintain a good relationship with them and because it makes her feel active. In the future, she would like to open a shoes and clothes store. This is her second loan with MFP and what she likes the most about her community bank is that his partners are very responsible and, especially, very open. With the money she’s requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and a display cabinet to show them and keep them better protected.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products and a display cabinet

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris A., 35 years old, comes from Talim Island, Binangonan, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 4 children. She is a member of Malacaban center in Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), Rizal South Branch. She is a persevering woman because even at her younger age, she is still working hard for the betterment of her businesses.

In 1996, she joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She has utilized her loans in her fishing business. Since she became a member of ASHI, she has been able to maintain very good performance. She is now requesting a loan of Php 35,000.00 pesos to use as additional capital for her business. Specifically the loan fund will be use to buy fish net, bamboo, and rope, and as payment for labor.

She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and of saving for her family's future. She is positive that with the capital accessed through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of sending her children to a university will also be achieved. She wants to thank ASHI and Kiva for the greatest opportunity which has enabled her to start reaching for her goal. Maricris and her husband feel very happy with the loan that changed their lives to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fish net, bamboo, and rope, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn T., 34, is a widow who lives with her two school-aged children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. T. has a business of weaving traditional baskets and mats for sale. She is able to earn an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2006. 

T. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, T. is requesting a loan of $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more materials to produce more baskets for her customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy more materials to produce baskets and mats for sale

loans.name: Brenda Lisset

texts.es: Brenda tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Este no es primer financiamiento que obtiene, por lo que ha sido algo muy importante en su vida para el desarrollo de su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, todos los días por la mañana elle recorre los diferentes lugares que tiene que visitar para ofrecer sus productos. Ella es un ejemplo a seguir para muchas mujeres que no tienen un trabajo estable para perseverar sus sueños. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, desodorantes y pinturas de uñas. El sueño de ella ha sido establecer una tienda en la que ofrezca una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Brenda is 33 years old and has spent 15 years in this business. She has received other loans in the past that have been a very important part of her life in that they helped develop her business. She sells cosmetics. Brenda is young and very active and dynamic. She likes to work and every morning she travels around to the various locations she sells her products. She sets an example for many women who don't have a steady job to go after their dreams. Brenda will use this loan as capital for her business to buy creams, perfumes, deodorants and nail polish. Her dream is to establish a store that offers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business captial

loans.name: Denise Delhia

texts.fr: C. Denise Delhia est née le 9 octobre 1961 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Denise Delhia vit depuis 20 ans au quartier Agla à Cotonou.  Mariée à NADOHOU Steve, professeur au Lycée Technique de Coulibaly, Denise Delhia est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Denise Delhia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Denise Delhia vend divers produits (lait, sucre, bougies, piles, fournitures scolaires, etc.) dans sa boutique à Agla. De façon secondaire, Denise Delhia vend de la friperie (jeans, tee-shirts, etc).  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays à coté du Bénin, que Denise Delhia s’approvisionne.  Denise Delhia exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Denise Delhia sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour élever le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Denise Delhia C. was born on 9 October 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Denise Delhia has lived for 20 years in the Agla district in Cotonou. Married to Steve Nadohou, a teacher at the Lycée Technique (Technical School) of Coulibaly, Denise Delhia is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school and in her care. Denise Delhia lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. Denise Delhia sells various goods (milk, sugar, candles, batteries, school supplies, etc.) at her store in Agla. As a second activity, Denise Delhia also sells second-hand clothing (jeans, t-shirts, etc.). She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin. Denise Delhia has run this business for 15 years and has already obtained one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. Denise Delhia is seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ to raise the level of her business and better respond to the various needs of her customers; this will allow her to generate a larger income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two boxes of milk cartons, one carton of sugar packets, and one dozen jeans and shirts

loans.name: Batiome

texts.en:
Batiome runs the Jaka general store located near industrial and residential areas in Mombasa. She sells items like detergents, cooking oil, cereals, and green groceries. Her business challenges are lack of transportation to the area she sells in. 

Previously, Batiome had a video business, but she has been in the general store business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to have an expanded store and have other stores in other parts of Mombasa and maybe other towns. Batiome is currently married and has one young son, aged 4.

loans.use: increasing her inventory

loans.name: Alicia's Group

texts.en:
Alicia D. is from the village of Bandera. She is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is D. Group.
Alicia is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average per month from these activities.
In 2009, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en: Bolortuya is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment, which they own. Her two children, ages five and three, attend a local kindergarten. During the day, Bolortuya operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Norjin. She sells a variety of women's clothing to her many customers. She started her business in 2006. Her business has grown quickly over the years and she has gained much experience as a businesswoman.  Today, her working capital exceeds 3,500,000 tugrugs (~2465 USD) and her daily revenue is between 50,000 – 70,000 tugrugs (~35–50 USD). Furthermore, Bolortuya's business profit is 40% and she has been planning to expand her business. She also built a garage for 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1407 USD) and rents it to car owners for a profit. Bolortuya is a very hard working person and the most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. She would like to be financially secure for her children in the future. She is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more clothing from China to sell at her local market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally R. is married and lives in the province of Rizal, in the Philippines, with her husband and two children. Sally is a hard working entrepreneur with her food vending business. She has been in business working as an entrepreneur for almost 10 years. Sally would like to receive a loan to purchase additional inventory for her food selling business. She is planning to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, starch, rice, coconut, cooking oil, eggs, chicken meat, banana, sweet potato, pasta and other supplies. Sally believes that having a greater variety of inventory will help her to retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. 
 
Sally is grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund the continued education of her children. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Sally is determined to achieve business success to build more long term financial security for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products such as sugar, starch, rice, coconut, cooking oil, eggs, chicken meat, banana, sweet potato, pasta and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 28 years old and resides with other family members in a wooden house located in a rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She got married many years ago to Sarim, 31, who currently breaks stone block and sells it to earn a living. The couple is blessed with a lovely baby. 

S. is a domestic farmer who has been planting crops since she was single. It is an annual business she has done for a long time. The coming rainfall season allows for farming, but S. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow

loans.name: Lampei Ole

texts.en:
Lampei Ole O. is 34 years old. He is married to Doris O. and is the father of three children.

Lampei is a small-scale farmer. He does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET through a market-awareness exercise done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more maize, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lampei's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: He is planning to plant 5 acres of maize

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single woman with two children who both attend school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent, school fees, and food. She decided to work with Yehu in order to improve her living conditions. 

For three years, Elizabeth has operated a business selling wholesale firewood to companies and schools. She faces the major challenge of transportation. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Elizabeth wants to purchase a power saw. In the future, she hopes to have a larger wholesale firewood business.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw for cutting firewood to sell.

loans.name: Georgette Gisèle

texts.fr: D. Georgette Gisèle est née en 1955 et vit depuis trente deux ans à Sodjèatimè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Georgette Gisèle est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont actuellement à sa charge. Georgette Gisèle vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs charges. Georgette Gisèle n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Georgette Gisèle vend de l'huile d'arachide à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses besoins. Georgette Gisèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui avait obtenu quatre crédits et qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Georgette Gisèle désire augmenter son stock de produits et diversifier son activité par la vente de pièces de rechanges ; raison pour laquelle Georgette Gisèle sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Georgette Gisèle D. was born in 1955 and has been living for the past 32 years in the Sodjèatimè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Georgette Gisèle is a widow and the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom two are currently under her care. Georgette Gisèle lives alone with her children and is their sole provider. Georgette Gisèle has only attended primary school. She has been selling peanut oil from her home over the past twenty years, which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having been granted four loans, all of which were duly repaid. She wishes to increase her stock of products and diversify her offerings by retailing spare parts, which is the reason she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of peanut oil and spare parts

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Loreta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Loreta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Roda is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees.

loans.use: to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has 3 school-age children. He has made his living as a professional driver. He operates a van service for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 15 years. His income from his taxi business is vital to the development and care of his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 to perform much needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body and re-paint the body. He hopes that these improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers. In the future, he wishes to purchase a new car so that he can continue to expand his business.

loans.use: perform much needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body and re-paint the body

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 52-year-old lady who is married with five children aged between 34 and 21. She is a greengrocer in the busy Githurai market and she says that her business is able to make her a profit of Kshs 15,000 per month. Her husband is a businessman who also contributes to the family’s total income.

Grace joined KADET after her friend introduced her. She is now applying for her fifth loan which she will use to add more stock of fruit which includes oranges, mangoes, bananas, passionfruit and others. 

Grace hopes to buy a big lorry in the near future which will make it easy for her to buy much more fruit from farmers and thus sell wholesale to others.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit like oranges, mangoes, bananas and passionfruit

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Bungad. She is 46 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business providing watch repair. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Koné est un homme marié de 49 ans polygame qui est père de douze enfants. Il  vit avec ses deux épouses à Socourani, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
 Monsieur Koné adhéra au programme crédit du prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son sixième cycle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés et à temps.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir acheter,  20 tonnes  de maïs pour les revendre à Bamako, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs et de quelques consommateurs.  Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  150. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais scolaire, de santé, de nourriture et ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed Koné is 49 years old, polygamous and the father of 12. He lives with his two wives in a traditional extended family in Socourani, a village in the subprefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba, the third administrative region (Sikasso) of Mali.

Mr. Koné has joined the individual loan program of Soro Yirwaso because of his business of storing and selling cereals, and is now on his sixth loan. All prior loans have been repaid on time.

With this loan he plans to purchase 20 tons [about 44000 lbs] of corn in order to resell them to Bamako, to a customer base composed mainly of resellers as well as some consumers. He stocks up in the nearby villages and hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 150,000 West African francs, which will be used to for school fees, healthcare and food expenses. Hi s goal is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con cuatro hijos, tiene grado D. instrucción D. primaria incompleta.
Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero pudo utilizar para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado vacuno.
La señora solicitara un nuevo monto S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es conversar y la unión.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ciudad Nueva” (New City), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Flavia did not finish her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. The first loan she requested was for 300 PEN, which she used to increase her business capital for fattening cattle.

Sra. Flavia is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3000 PEN so that she can increase the operating capital for her business. Her dream is to grow in her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the conversations and the unity.

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the second loan that Helen has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is from the village of Kauswagan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Celsa is married with four school-aged children. Celsa  is a rice farmer. Celsa has had her business for over four years and earns approximately 6700 PHP a month.

In 2007, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services for her business. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis de 27 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde joven le gusto mantener a sus hijos ya que se unió a su esposa muy joven.  Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio ha trabajado como comerciante informal hace varios años. 

Como no conseguía trabajo fijo decidió iniciar como comerciante informal y empezar a vender juguetes, sandalias, carteras etc. En la actualidad trabaja solo recorriendo las calles de los pueblos que visita para vender mercadería como Milagros, Santa Elena, Playas. La mercadería la vende por unidad a diferentes precios. 

El quiere continuar con sus ventas de mercadería variada para darles una buena vida a sus hijos de 8 y 4 años por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo juguetes, sabanas, sandalias etc. Una de sus proyecciones para los próximos 5 años es tener un capital estable para ubicar un local.
texts.en:
Luis, 27 years old, is a working man who has enjoyed taking care of his children since youth, as he married his wife very young. Living in an urban area known as a suburb, he has worked as an informal merchant for several years.

Since he could not find a permanent job, he started working as an informal merchant and started selling toys, sandals, wallets, etc… Now he works alone along the streets of the neighborhoods that he visits to sell his merchandise such as Milagros, Santa Elena, Playas. He sells his merchandise by the unit at varying prices.

He wants to continue his sales in diverse merchandise in order to give a good life to his children of 8 and 4 years old. For this reason, he wants to use this loan to purchase toys, sheets, sandals, etc… One of his securities for the next 5 years is to have a stable uncome to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase toys, sheets

loans.name: Loyce Njoki

texts.en:
Loyce has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  She is 55 years old and married to Paul Ronge, and they have three children.

Loyce was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the new loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Loyce plans to practice large scale farming, employing technology to better her produce.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Heidy Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Heidy Lucía Martínez A. es trabajadora de un Centro de Capacitación, desempeñando el cargo de Secretaria Ejecutiva, desde hace 2 años y 3 meses.

Es Soltera, de 24 años de edad, no tiene personas a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Managua en Las Américas número dos.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para invertir en gastos médicos propios y de su familia, ponerse unas piezas dentales, hacerse ultrasonidos y comprar unos lentes. Agradece a CEPRODEL por ayudarle con este préstamo en estos momentos que tanto necesita el dinero.
texts.en:
Doña Heidy Lucía Martínez A. works at a training center as an executive secretary. She has been in this job for two years and three months.

Heidy is 24 years old, single, and does not have any dependents. She lives in the city of Managua in Las Américas #2.

This is the first loan she has requested from CEPRODEL. She will invest the funds in personal medical expenses for herself and her family including dentures, ultrasound exams, and eyeglasses. Heidy is grateful to CEPRODEL for helping her with this loan at a time when she needs the money.

loans.use: Personal & family medical expenses

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en: Enhbold, 32, lives with his wife and a son in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, which is set up in a friend's backyard. He makes a living running a carpentry business. In 2008, he began to making wood products in his yard and now turns out quite a bit of furniture and structural elements for gers. He is an honest and hardworking person who says, "I would like to make and sell more products in order to have my own land where I can build a house". He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy more supplies and meet an increase in orders from his customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for a small business

loans.name: Mahmadmurod

texts.en:
S. Mahmadmurod is 41 years old. He is married and the father of two children. Mahmadmurod is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Mahmadmurod has been in agrobusiness for more than 4 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving wife is also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money to improve the well-being of his family. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of $2200 USD. Mahmadmurod appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.   

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose G. is from the village of Quezon San Isidro. She is 41 years old. Mary Rose is married with two school-aged children. Mary Rose runs a business selling cosmetics. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Mary Rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services she provides. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase the materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her second loan from ASKI. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. has worked as a fish vendor for 20 years. She is from Ntranoa, near Elmina. She is a widow and serves as the sole breadwinner for her seven children. 

To increase her income, she needs to grow her sales. The loan will help her purchase larger quantities of fish. The additional profits will be used to provide for her family and to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to offer for resale

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 24 years old married man, living with his wife and child in Bint Jbeil. Abass opened his own shop in 2003, with 12 years of experience. He was still a child when he started working, and it all was for the sake of helping his family in their living expenses. Abass works in painting furniture, in addition to houses. He is an expert in his field in his clients opinion. 

Abass is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business; he wants to open a shop where he can sell all types of painting materials and tools. Abass seeks improvement, he is willing to educate his child with the best education available, and seeks to provide him with the best childhood possible since he didn't live his appropriately. Abass is a person with good manners, he works hard to prove his abilities and he translates his dreams into practical reality.

loans.use: to buy house painting materials and products to open a retail shop

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em P., 31, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Chao and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 5 each per day. When available from the farming business, her husband is also a blacksmith. Each month, the family has to spend USD 58 on food and USD 74 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase pig food and pigs to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pig food and pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto M. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos a su cuidado. Él vive en la zona de Puntiti de la Provincia Chapare del departamento de Cochabamba en la casa de sus queridos abuelos. Por la dedicación que él tiene con su familia le otorgaron un cuarto donde él puede vivir dignamente.
Humberto trabaja brindando seguridad en la zona de Pacata Alta de la ciudad de Cochabamba, todos los días él pone mucho empeño en su trabajo para que así otorgue una mayor tranquilidad a los vecinos de su zona; aunque el trabajo conlleva muchos riesgos a su integridad física y emocional él lo hace porque tiene las aptitudes para ese trabajo.   
Humberto necesita el préstamo para que pueda refaccionar y mejorar el cuarto que habita y así pueda mejorar su nivel de vida. Él está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de contar con dinero para mejorar su vivienda.
Humberto entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre una motocicleta y así pueda hacer un mejor patrullaje en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Humberto M. is 25 years old, single and does not yet have any children in his care. He lives in the zone of Puntiti in the province of Chapare, department of Cochabamba. He lives in the house of his cherished grandparents. Because of the dedication that he has to his family, they gave him a room where he can live with dignity.

Humberto works in security in the zone of Pacata Alta in the city of Cochabamba. Every day he puts a lot of effort into his job in order to give the residents in the area a greater sense of calm. Even though his job has a lot of risks to his physical and emotional integrity, he does it because he has the skills and abilities necessary for this work.

Humberto needs a loan to refurbish and improve the room where he lives and thereby improve his quality of life. He is very grateful to the people who, through Kiva, could give him the opportunity to have the money to improve his home.

Humberto's future plans include taking out another loan to buy a motorcycle and therefore be able to get a better patrol at his job.

loans.use: to refurbish his home.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has six children.

Ahmad opened a shop selling chickens in 2005. He gained good experience. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a chicken cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and buy a chicken cleaning machine.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. Elsa has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell. Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additIonal stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La sra Porfiria es casada, su marido vive hacia el interior del pais, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, los cuales estudian y trabajan, ella se dedica a la compra y ventas D. bebidas en su domicilio.
El crédito será D. ayuda para la compra D. mas mercaderias para el equipamiento D. su negocio, ya que tiene ofertas para el mismo. 
Ña Porfiria sueña con abrir una bodega,con una gran variedad D. productos, sobre la calle principal D. su ciudad y asi dar fuentes D. trabajo a otras personas.
Es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y desea con mucha fe poder darles un futuro mejor al presente que viven, es un poco difícil según ella por la pobreza que existe pero espera poder alcanzar su meta.
texts.en:
Porfiria is married, and her husband lives in the interior of the country.  She has two adult children who go to school and work.  She buys and sells drinks in her home.

The loan will be to help buy more merchandise to equip her business; she already has bids for the merchandise.

Porfiria dreams of opening a general store with a great variety of products on the main street in her city.  That way she will give other people a source of work.

She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She wishes, with great faith, to give them a better future than what they are living.  It is a little difficult, she says, because of the poverty that exists, but she hopes to be able to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy drinks (beer, whiskey, and wine, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carros, el trabaja en el área de taller de mecánica, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar artefacto para su casa como un televisor.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Patron San Sebastian” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco within the Cusco department.

The member is 30 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. The member alternates his daily activities with a business in car sales. He works in the mechanic area. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Through this business the member helps his children get ahead. He wants to expand the car sales business. The member is requesting a loan to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television. 
                                                 
The member is happy about receiving the loan and he is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, two boys and two girls. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

For the past 15 years, she has operated a vegetable-stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable operators in her area. Her dream is to own a plot of land in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with seven family members. Three of the family members work.

Haydar has been an owner of a store selling mobiles and accessories since 2008.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and is well known in his area.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Celestina works on her rice farm, harvesting & selling rice. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.
Celestina  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Celestina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cristo Rey - El Tambo Group

texts.es: LA SRA ROCIO D.  33 AÑOS D. EDAD, CONVIVIENTE CON DOS HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD ,ES SOCIA D. LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  CRISTO REY, SE LE CONSIDERO ESTE TERCER CICLO YA QUE LA SRA ANTERIORMENTE EN LOS ANTERIORES CICLOS  DEMOSTRO SER  RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL  AL IGUAL QUE SUS DEMAS COMPAÑEROS QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA COMUNAL .LA SRA EN LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE SU PROPIA PANADERIA,SOLICITO ESTE CREDITO PARA PODER  COMPRAR MAS  EQUIPOS  PARA SU PANADERIA  Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS . LA SRA ROCIO QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN  HORNO MAS Y TAMBIEN QUISIERA  SACAR PROFESIONALES A SUS HIJOS. LA SRA ROCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO IZQUIERDO D. LA  SRA  QUE VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR FUCSIA Y PANTALON COLOR NEGRO, LA SRA  ROCIO VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR PLOMO Y PANTALON JEANS
texts.en: Rocio is 33 years old, and lives with her partner and two young children.  She is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) Community Bank and is being considered for her third loan cycle as she has previously proven herself to be responsible and punctual.  Along with the other members of this group, she has her own bakery.  She asked for this loan to be able to buy more equipment for her bakery in order to increase earnings.  In the future, Rocio would like to have another oven and for her children to be professionals.  Rocio can be found to the right of the woman wearing a pink sweater and black pants.  Rocio is wearing a gray sweater and jeans.

loans.use: buy more equipment

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso 1 (New Progress). This is a group composed of five businesswomen. All of them are working to improve their own lives and the lives of their families, as they are living in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city. 

Sonia makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their four children. She is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products. She has been selling these products for almost a year, starting after one of her neighbors give her some products to sell. Then, after she was able to save some money, she started selling by herself. She will buy three boxes of household products of different types.

She will save her profits to finish building her house. Her most difficult challenge is to get married in the church. She likes to sing and wants to become a professional. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy household products for resale

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She earns a living as a public school teacher and has been in this profession for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6237. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to install electric wiring in her home.  She has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a farm.
